   OKADA, I
TI ISOTOPE AND TEMPERATURE EFFECTS OF THE VIBRATIONAL AND ROTATIONAL
   RELAXATION IN MOLTEN ALKALI HYDROXIDES
SO MOLECULAR PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID OH ION; RAMAN; DYNAMICS; LIOH; SPECTROSCOPY; DEPENDENCE; MOTION; NAOH
AB Polarized and depolarized Raman spectra have been measured for the symmetric stretching modes of hydroxide ions in molten NaOH, KOH, NaOD, and KOD over the temperature range 593-873 K. The vibrational and rotational autocorrelation functions, C(v)(t) and C(r)(t), respectively, have been evaluated from Fourier transformation of the spectra. The vibrational and rotational relaxation rates of OD- ions obtained are compared with those of OH ions. For all the systems, the vibrational relaxation time-tau(v) became larger with increasing temperature and, after reaching a maximum, it decreased. This observation can be explained on the assumption that, at lower temperatures, the motional narrowing effect is predominant for the band width and, at higher temperatures, inhomogeneous broadening by the activated motions of the oscillator becomes crucial. All the rotational autocorrelation functions show rapid and oscillatory decay for short times t and slow and exponential decay for longer times. The former is caused by the libration of the hydroxide ion and the latter is based on its reorientational motion. With increasing temperature, the rotational relaxation time-tau(r) becomes shorter and is described well by the Arrhenius equation. Further, the differences in relaxation between NaOH and NaOD or between KOH and KOD at a given temperature can be attributed to the reduced masses of the oscillators for the vibrational relaxation and to the moments of inertia of the rotors for the rotational relaxation.
RP SUZUKI, Y (reprint author), TOKYO INST TECHNOL,DEPT ELECTR CHEM,4259 NAGATSUTA,MIDORI KU,YOKOHAMA,KANAGAWA 227,JAPAN.

TI PHASE-LOCKED EPITAXY AND STRUCTURAL-ANALYSIS OF FE/AU(100) ARTIFICIAL
   SUPERLATTICES
SO APPLIED SURFACE SCIENCE
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 1ST INTERNATIONAL SYMP ON ATOMICALLY CONTROLLED SURFACES AND INTERFACES
   ( ACSI-1 )
CY NOV 19-22, 1991
CL TOKYO, JAPAN
SP JAPAN SOC APPL PHYS
ID ENERGY ELECTRON-DIFFRACTION; RHEED INTENSITY OSCILLATION; METALLIC
   OVERLAYERS; GROWTH; FILMS; FE
AB By counting peaks of the reflection high-energy electron diffraction (RHEED) intensity oscillation, bcc-Fe/fcc-Au(100) superlattices were synthesized artificially. Using the Hendricks and Teller method, a statistical distribution of the superlattice periods is obtained from the X-ray diffraction pattern. A relation between fluctuations of superlattice periods, an interfacial alloying, and the irregular pattern of the RHEED intensity oscillations is discussed.

   YAMAMOTO, H
TI THE ROLE OF AL2O3 IN THE LONG-TERM CORROSION STABILITY OF NUCLEAR WASTE
   GLASSES
SO JOURNAL OF NUCLEAR MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article
ID ION MASS-SPECTROMETRY; ALUMINOSILICATE
AB The corrosion stability of borosilicate waste glasses has been investigated, as a function of the AlO1.5 (in balance with SiO2) content. The AlO1.5 content ranged from 6.7 to 18.2 mol%. Surface area to solution volume (SA/V) values of 100, 500, 2500 and 10000 m-1, and temperatures of 90 and 150-degrees-C were considered. High SA/V and T were especially used to accelerate the corrosion. The leaching medium was distilled water, total durations up to 600 days, and the tests were interpreted in terms of solution composition either without or after ultrafiltration. The data reveal that long term dissolution of the soluble elements B, Na and Li is diffusion-controlled for all glasses. SA/V appears to be a meaningful corrosion accelerating parameter. The glass composition determines the sequence and kind of the dissolution processes, but final solution data for the soluble elements are not that different. The "final" experimental data for B range between 700 and 1050 mgl-1 at 90-degrees-C (105 days at 10000 m-1), and between 19000 and 56000 mgl-1 at 150-degrees-C (400 days at 10000 m-1).

TI PICOSECOND OPTICAL CONVERSION FROM SELF-TRAPPED EXCITON TO F-H CENTER
   PAIRS IN ALKALI CHLORIDE CRYSTALS
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
DE TIME DELAYED DOUBLE EXCITATION; PICOSECOND SPECTROSCOPY; SELF-TRAPPED
   EXCITON; F-CENTER; H-CENTER; OPTICAL CONVERSION; PRECURSOR STATE; KCL;
   NACL; RBCL
ID DEFECT FORMATION; HALIDE CRYSTALS; RECOMBINATION LUMINESCENCE;
   PI-LUMINESCENCE; NACL; STATES; RELAXATION; PULSE; KCL
AB The picosecond spectroscopy with the time delayed double excitation technique has revealed that the F-H center pair ([F-H]) is converted from the self-trapped exciton (STE(L)) at the a1g state within 20 ps in KCl, NaCl and RbCl at 14 K. Conversion efficiencies from the STE(L) to the [F-H] and to unknown X states were estimated by assuming two possible candidates of the hole pi(g) state or the higher electronic state in the STE as the precursor for [F-H] formation. Percentages of branching from the precursor to the [F-H] were 49, 86 and 20% in KCl, NaCl and RbCl, respectively. Rest of the STE were converted to unknown X states. By making use of these results, we criticized the state acceptable as the precursor, i.e., the hole pi(g) state or the electronic states.

TI TRANSIENT F-H CENTER PAIRS PRODUCED FROM SELF-TRAPPED EXCITONS AT THE
   LOWEST TRIPLET-STATE IN ALKALI CHLORIDE CRYSTALS
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
DE TIME DELAYED DOUBLE EXCITATION; PICOSECOND SPECTROSCOPY; F-CENTERS;
   H-CENTERS; SELF-TRAPPED EXCITONS; OPTICAL CONVERSION; RBCL; KCL; NACL
ID DEFECT FORMATION; HALIDE CRYSTALS; NACL; KCL
AB Time delayed double excitation spectroscopy in the picosecond range has revealed transient F bands due to the F center perturbed by an H center at the next nearest site, [F-H]nnn, in RbCl, KCl and NaCl single crystals after excitation of the self-trapped exciton (STE) from the lowest triplet state to higher excited states. The F band consists of a doublet peaking at 1.99 and 2. 11 eV (RbCl), at 2.25 and 2.38 eV (KCl) and at 2.70 and 2.86 eV (NaCl) with the ratio of 2:1 in height in every crystal at 108 ps after the excitation. The peak positions and relative height of the doublets are understood qualitatively by the theory for the off-center type STE. No dichroism of the doublet observed by the light polarized in the [100] or [010] direction suggests rotation of the [F-H] axis during relaxation from the electronic b1u state, but not necessarily from the hole excited pi(g) state.

TI ALPHA-CLUSTER FORMATION IN NE-20 IN THE CLUSTER-ORBITAL SHELL-MODEL .2.
SO PROGRESS OF THEORETICAL PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID RESONATING-GROUP-METHOD; SOFT DIPOLE MODE; ENERGY-LEVELS; HE-ISOTOPES;
   TI-44; SCATTERING; NUCLEUS; SYSTEM; LI-11; DECAY
AB A cluster-orbital shell model is applied to study the mechanism of alpha-cluster formation in Ne-20. For this purpose a realistic effective interaction between the valence nucleons is carefully determined and tested through the low-lying levels of the sd shell nuclei. A calculation including all the configurations up to 4H-omegaBAR excitation is done for the 0+ levels of Ne-20. Three 0+ states that correspond to the states at E(x) = 0, 6.72 and 10.97 MeV are reproduced very well. The calculation also predicts such a state that has a large reduced alpha-width amplitude and can be considered the broad state at 8.7 MeV. The percentage analysis of the wave functions is done to shed light on the mechanism of alpha-cluster formation.

TI GLAUBER MODEL ANALYSIS OF THE FRAGMENTATION REACTION CROSS-SECTIONS OF
   LI-11
SO NUCLEAR PHYSICS A
LA English
DT Article
ID ELECTROMAGNETIC DISSOCIATION; PROJECTILE FRAGMENTATION; NUCLEUS
   SCATTERING; EXOTIC NUCLEI; HIGH-ENERGIES; COLLISIONS; RADII
AB A theory to evaluate the reaction, interaction, and two-neutron removal cross sections of Li-11
   is presented in the framework of the Glauber theory in order to elucidate the role of the halo-neutron density distribution. The nuclear parts of the cross sections can be calculated with the neutron densities as input. Two kinds of the densities are compared with experiment at 800 MeV/nucleon. A good agreement with experiment is obtained for light targets. It is emphasized that the optical-limit approximation is not good for calculating the reaction cross section of a nucleus with halo structure. The reaction mechanism underlying the two-neutron removal process is discussed in some detail. A relation of meson-production cross sections with the property of the profile function is also discussed.
C1 NIIGATA UNIV,DEPT PHYS,NIIGATA 95021,JAPAN.

TI POLARIZATION-INSENSITIVE SUPERLUMINESCENT DIODE AT 1.5-MU-M WITH A
   TENSILE-STRAINED-BARRIER MQW

ID HIGH-POWER
AB Polarization-insensitive high-power superluminescent diodes emitting at 1.5-mu-m were fabricated by using a tensile-strained-barrier MQW. Polarization difference as low as 5% and 3.8 mW optical power were obtained at 260 mA injection current.

TI CONOSCOPIC STUDY OF THE SC-ALPHA-ASTERISK PHASE AND THE DEVILS STAIRCASE
   IN AN ANTIFERROELECTRIC LIQUID-CRYSTAL
SO LIQUID CRYSTALS
LA English
DT Article
ID MHPOBC
AB The molecular orientational structure of the S(C-alpha)* phase has been studied by means of X-ray, dielectric and conoscopic measurements for 4-(1-methylheptyloxycarbonyl) phenyl 4'-octylcarbonyloxybiphenyl-4-carboxylate. It was found by X-ray scattering that the S(C-alpha)* phase is tilted. According to the conoscopic observation under a low field, the optic plane of S(C-alpha)* is parallel to the field direction similar to that of the S(C-gamma)* phase of 4-(1-methylheptyloxycarbonyl)phenyl 4'-octyloxybiphenyl-4-carboxylate. It was also found that the molecular orientation of the S(C-alpha)* phase is antiferroelectric in the high temperature region, while in the low temperature region it is ferrielectric and changes with temperature, suggesting the so-called Devil's staircase. The critical temperature, where the biaxiality and the tilt angle of the average optic axis have maximum values, was assigned to the ferrielectric state with the largest spontaneous polarization.

TI HIGH-SPEED HETEROJUNCTION FET IC TECHNOLOGY FOR OPTICAL
   COMMUNICATION-SYSTEMS
SO NEC RESEARCH & DEVELOPMENT
LA English
DT Article
DE HETEROJUNCTION FET; OPTICAL COMMUNICATION SYSTEM; PSEUDOMORPHIC 2DEG
   (2-DIMENSIONAL ELECTRON GAS) FET; DMT (DOPED-CHANNEL HETEROMISFET);
   LASER DRIVER; OPTICAL MODULATION DRIVER; PREAMPLIFIER; D-TYPE FLIP FLOP
AB High-speed ICs for 10 Gbit/s optical communication systems have been developed using AlGaAs/GaAs DMTs (Doped-channel hetero-MISFETs) and AlGaAs/InGaAs/GaAs pseudomorphic 2DEG (Two-Dimensional Electron Gas) FETs with a gate length of 0.35 mum. The ICs are fabricated using heterojunction FET IC technology with advanced processes, such as direct-writing electron beam lithography; airbridge interconnects and WSiN thin film resistors. The laser driver IC has driven 25 OMEGA load with 60 mA(P-P) at 10 Gbit/s data rate. The optical modulator driver IC has operated up to 10 Gbit/s with 4 V(P-P) high output voltage swing. The bandwidth for the preamplifier IC is 13.0 GHz with a 47 dB OMEGA transimpedance gain. The D-type flip/flop IC has operated at 10 Gbit/s.

TI THE EFFECT OF BENZYLVIOLOGEN ON MANGANESE PORPHYRIN-CATALYZED
   EPOXIDATION REACTION OF CYCLOHEXENE
SO NIPPON KAGAKU KAISHI
LA Japanese
DT Article
ID OXYGEN ACTIVATION; P-450 MODEL; DIOXYGEN; SYSTEM; COMPLEXES
AB A large amount of cyclohexene oxide is obtained by the addition of benzylviologen bromide (BVBr2) in the air-equilibrated acetonitrile solution containing (5, 10, 15, 20-tetraphenylporphyrinato)manganese(III) chloride ([Mn(III)(tpp)]Cl) as amonooxygenase catalyst, zinc powder as a reductant, benzoic anhydride as an acylating agent and cyclohexene as a substrate. The turnover number of the catalyst of about 100 is obtained for 12 h (reaction time). The result implies that BV2+ ion plays an important role as an electron mediator from zinc powder to manganese porphyrin. Further the effectiveness of BV2+ ion is discussed in detail from the dependence of the quantity of the produced epoxide on the concentration of [Mn(III)(tpp)]Cl and 1-methylimidazole as an axial ligand.

TI STATUS OF THE JAERI FEL - BEAM TEST FOR INJECTION SYSTEM
SO NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION A-ACCELERATORS
   SPECTROMETERS DETECTORS AND ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 13TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON FREE ELECTRON LASER
CY AUG 25-30, 1991
CL SANTA FE, NM
SP USAF, OFF SCI RES, USA, STRATEG DEF COMMAND, US DOE, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, US STRATEG DEF INITIAT OFF, US NAVAL RES LAB
AB The injection system of the JAERI superconducting linac for far infrared FEL oscillation was installed and commissioned. The characteristics of the electron beam measured, so far, are as follows: an electron beam of 100 mA with 4 ns bunch length was extracted from the gun at the accelerating voltage of 180-220 kV. The beam was compressed tentatively to less than 70 ps at the end of the transport line by preliminary operation of both the sub-harmonic buncher and the buncher.

   YOSHIDA, S
TI FLUX-DENSITY DISTRIBUTION IN BI2SR2CACU2OX AND ITS CRITICAL CURRENT
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article
AB Flux density distribution of Bi2Sr2CaCu2Ox sintered specimens prepared by partial melt process (critical temperature T(c) approximately 90 K) was observed by a magneto-optical method using iron garnet films at various temperatures.  The flux penetration and trapping processes were inhomogeneous, reflecting that the specimens consist of an assemblage of laminated grains without preferential orientation.  It was found that flux hardly penetrates into the center of the specimen, though the flux density distribution is inhomogeneous.  Critical current J(c), estimated from the averaged flux penetration using Bean's model, was nearly equal to that estimated from magnetization.  These results indicate that the regions with high critical current connect directly with each other without weak-link in Bi2Sr2CaCu2Ox specimens prepared by partial melt process.

TI REENTRANT ANTIFERROELECTRIC PHASE IN 4-(1-METHYLHEPTYLOXYCARBONYL)PHENYL
   4'-OCTYLBIPHENYL-4-CARBOXYLATE
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE ANTIFERROELECTRICITY; FERROELECTRICITY; FERRIELECTRICITY; DIELECTRIC
   CONSTANT; RELAXATION FREQUENCY; CONOSCOPIC OBSERVATION; OPTICAL PITCH;
   REENTRANT PHASE
ID CHIRAL SMECTIC PHASES
AB The presence of three phases was found between SmA and the antiferroelectric SmCA* phase in optically active (R)-4-(1-methylheptyloxycarbonyl)phenyl 4'-octylbiphenyl-4-carboxylate. Two of these phases were identified as SmC-alpha* and SmC-gamma* by the miscibility test. The remaining phase between these was confirmed to be another antiferroelectric phase from dielectric measurement and conoscopic observation. Thus, antiferroelectric order appears at least three times: SmC-alpha*, the new antiferroelectric phase and SmCA*. The new antiferroelectric phase is different from the SmC* phase in that it exhibits much lower stability against an electric field.

TI SURVEY OF ATMOSPHERIC NEUTRINO DATA AND IMPLICATIONS FOR NEUTRINO MASS
   AND MIXING
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID OSCILLATIONS; FLUX; KAMIOKANDE; DETECTOR; SEARCH
AB A detailed comparison is made of the atmospheric neutrino results obtained by the Frejus, IMB-3, and Kamiokande detectors. The implications of these results for vacuum neutrino oscillations are presented, and juxtaposed with the results for matter neutrino oscillations from the solar neutrino data.

AU Yamauchi, H
   Tashiro, Y
   Minami, T
   Suzuki, Y
AF Yamauchi, Hironori
   Tashiro, Yutaka
   Minami, Toshihiro
   Suzuki, Yutaka
TI Architecture and Implementation of a Highly Parallel Single-Chip Video
   DSP
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON CIRCUITS AND SYSTEMS FOR VIDEO TECHNOLOGY
LA English
DT Article
AB The architecture of a Angle-chip video DSP capable of attaining a maximum performance of 300-MOPS (mega operations per second) using 0.8-mu m CMOS technology is described. The DSP Is designed for the many applications requiring p x 64 kb/s single-board video codecs based on DSP's that have roughly 10 times the performance of conventional DSP's. Highly parallel architectures that allow four pipelined processing units to be integrated into one chip are studied extensively. The paper considers data path configuration, program sequencing control, and microinstructions that effectively support multiple pipeline processing. A prototype DSP is fabricated using 0.8-mu m CMOS technology, and some performance evaluations am presented.

TI 38-GHZ-BAND HIGH-POWER MMIC AMPLIFIER MODULE FOR SATELLITES ON-BOARD USE
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON MICROWAVE THEORY AND TECHNIQUES
LA English
DT Article
ID MESFET MODEL; DESIGN
AB This paper presents the design and development results of 38-GHz high-power MMIC amplifier modules for use in the solid state power amplifier (SSPA) to be carried aboard Engineering Test Satellite VI in 1993. This amplifier will be used in millimeter-wave inter-satellite communication experiments. For the development of this amplifier, we designed high-power, highly reliable FET's with 0.25-mu-m-long gates. The FET large-signal impedance was accurately measured using an improved load-pull method and MMIC transformers. The measurements were used to design two types of MMIC's: one composed of two FET cells with 600-mu-m wide gates, and the other of four FET cells with 400-mu-m wide gates. We also developed a two-stage amplifier package consisting of two of these MMIC's that can be used at 38 GHz. We obtained a Po (1 dB) of 25 dBm and a gain of 11 dB. A 38-GHz test conducted during chip screening achieves a high production yield without circuits adjustment.
C1 MINIST POSTS & TELECOMMUN,COMMUN RES LABS,TOKYO 184,JAPAN.
RP SHIGAKI, M (reprint author), FUJITSU LABS LTD,1015 KAMIKODANAKA,NAKAHARA KU,KAWASAKI,KANAGAWA 211,JAPAN.

TI VAPORIZATION BEHAVIOR OF URANIUM PLUTONIUM MIXED NITRIDE
SO JOURNAL OF NUCLEAR MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL SYMP ON NUCLEAR MATERIALS FOR FISSION REACTORS, AT THE
   1991 FALL MEETING OF THE EUROPEAN MATERIALS RESEARCH SOC
CY NOV 05-08, 1991
CL STRASBOURG, FRANCE
SP EUROPEAN MAT RES SOC, COUNCIL EUROPE, COMMISS EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES, BANQUE POPULAIRE, CTR RECH NUCL, CNRS, ELSEVIER SCI PUBL, SERV DOCUMENTAT TOURIST PALAIS CONGRES STRASBOURG, EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT
ID FABRICATION; (U,PU)N; PELLETS
AB The vaporization behavior of UN, PuN and uranium-plutonium mixed nitride, (U, Pu)N, was observed by a Knudsen-effusion mass spectrometry. The mixed nitride samples with the wide PuN composition range were prepared by the homogenization of the mixtures of UN and PuN synthesized by the carbothermic reduction. The results of evaporation for UN and PuN agree reasonably with those reported previously. The partial pressures of U and Pu over mixed nitride were depressed by the formation of the solid solution of UN and PuN. The estimation of the activities and activity coefficients of UN and PuN in mixed nitride revealed that mixed nitride does not behave as an ideal solution. It is also suggested that mixed nitride evaporates congruently in the temperature range of the present study without the formation of any molten phase in a condition of Knudsen effusion.
RP SUZUKI, Y (reprint author), JAPAN ATOM ENERGY RES INST,OARAI,IBARAKI 31113,JAPAN.

TI STABILITY AND STRUCTURE OF THE DELTA-PHASE OF THE U-ZR ALLOYS
SO JOURNAL OF NUCLEAR MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL SYMP ON NUCLEAR MATERIALS FOR FISSION REACTORS, AT THE
   1991 FALL MEETING OF THE EUROPEAN MATERIALS RESEARCH SOC
CY NOV 05-08, 1991
CL STRASBOURG, FRANCE
SP EUROPEAN MAT RES SOC, COUNCIL EUROPE, COMMISS EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES, BANQUE POPULAIRE, CTR RECH NUCL, CNRS, ELSEVIER SCI PUBL, SERV DOCUMENTAT TOURIST PALAIS CONGRES STRASBOURG, EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT
AB Homogeneity range and crystal structure of the intermediate delta-phase in the U-Zr alloy were examined by electron probe microanalysis, X-ray diffraction and differential thermal analysis, using the alloys prepared by arc-melting. The homogeneity range of the delta-phase was found to be 64.2-78.2 at% Zr at 600-degrees-C and 66.5-80.2 at% Zr at 550-degrees-C. The powder diffraction patterns of the delta-phase agreed with an unusual structure of modified C32, in which the (0,0,0) sites are preferentially occupied by Zr atoms, and the (2/3, 1/3, 1/2) and (1/3, 2/3, 1/2) sites randomly shared by U and Zr atoms.

TI DISSOLUTION RATE AND SOLUBILITY OF COLLOIDAL HYDROUS FERRIC-OXIDE IN
   SEAWATER
SO MARINE CHEMISTRY
LA English
DT Article
ID KINETIC CONSTRAINTS; AQUEOUS-SOLUTIONS; IRON; PHYTOPLANKTON; RELEVANCE;
   MINERALS; WATER
AB Dissolution rate constants and solubilities of colloidal hydrous ferric oxide in seawater over the pH range 5.5-8.1 at 20-degrees-C were experimentally determined by dialysis techniques involving gamma-activity measurements of Fe-59. The Fe (III) dissolution rate was defined as a first-order reaction in proportion to the concentration of particulate Fe(III) in seawater. These Tate constants and solubilities within the pH range 6.8-8.1 were independent of pH with values: 0.015+/-0.002 day-1 and 1.05+/-0.05 X 10(-8) mol l-1, respectively. This result probably indicates the existence of Fe(OH)30 as well as Fe(OH)2+ in the normal pH range of seawater. At lower pHs, the logarithmic dissolution rate constants and solubilities increased linearly with decreasing pH with a slope of -0.55 and - 1.O. respectively. The Fe(III) dissolution rate of colloidal hydrous ferric oxide at the normal pH of seawater can be estimated from 0.015x[Fe(III)p] (conc. day-1) by the concentration of particulate Fe(III) in seawater.
RP KUMA, K (reprint author), HOKKAIDO UNIV,FAC FISHERIES,DEPT CHEM,HAKODATE,HOKKAIDO 041,JAPAN.

TI BREAK-UP EFFECT ON THE ELASTIC-SCATTERING AND THE OPTICAL-POTENTIAL OF
   LI-11
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW C
LA English
DT Article
ID DEUTERON; CHANNELS; MODEL
AB The elastic scattering of weakly bound projectiles such as deuteron and Li-11 nucleus are examined including the break-up process to the continuum excited states. The eikonal approximation is employed to derive the optical potential which includes the dynamical polarization potential due to the break-up process. The dynamical polarization potential is realized to be closely related to the fluctuation of the constituents of the projectile nucleus in its ground state. Strong effect of the break-up process on the Li-11-C-12 optical potential is found, which is qualitatively similar to those known for the deuteron optical potential. The elastic scattering differential cross section for Li-11-C-12 is calculated with the obtained optical potential. It is found that the scattering cross section decreases rapidly for large scattering angle compared with the Li-9 elastic scattering.

TI NEW MAGNETOOPTICAL TRANSITION IN ULTRATHIN FE(100) FILMS
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID KERR ROTATION; SMOKE SIGNALS; FE; SURFACE; AG(100); FE/CU;
   SUPERLATTICES; ENHANCEMENT; MONOLAYERS; FE/AU(100)
AB Magneto-optical polar Kerr effects in ultrathin bcc Fe(100) films sandwiched by Au layers were investigated in the 1.6-5.3 eV photon energy range at room temperature. A new peak appeared in the off-diagonal conductivity spectrum at around 3.5-4.5 eV for the Fe films thinner than 10 angstrom. The peak energy is lower for thinner Fe films. The absolute value of epsilon(xy) at 3.7 eV in the 3 angstrom thick Fe film is 2 times as large as that in the bulk Fe.

TI INVIVO EVALUATION OF ANTITHROMBOGENICITY AND SURFACE-ANALYSIS OF
   ION-IMPLANTED SILICONE-RUBBER
SO RADIATION PHYSICS AND CHEMISTRY
LA English
DT Article
ID DEPOSITION
AB The chemical and physical structure of ion-implanted silicone rubbers has been studied in order to analyze their blood compatibility such as reduction of platelet accumulation owing to ion implantation. H2+, He+, C+, O+, O2+, N+, N2+, Ne+, Na+, Ar+, K+, and Kr+ ion implantations were performed at an energy of 150 keV with fluences between 1 x 10(17) and 3 x 10(17) ions/cm2 at room temperature. Results of FT-IR-ATR showed that ion implantation broke the original chemical bond to form new radicals such as OH, > C = O, SiH, and CH2. The formation of these radicals depended on the ion species employed: > C = O formation by O+ or O2+ implantation and formation of amines by N+ or N2+ implantation. The results of Raman spectroscopy showed that ion implantation always produced a peak at near 1500 cm-1 although thc intensity of this peak was dependent on the ion species. The light ions like H2+ and He+ were more effective than heavy ions in producing this peak, and O2+ implantation was the most effective on producing amorphous carbon. These results indicated that > C = O and amorphous carbon, generated by O2+ implantation, may improve the antithrombogenicity. The antithrombogenicity was tested by the superior vena cava (SVC) indwelling method for two days in rats with in-111-tropolone-platelets, and by the inferior vena cava (IVC) indwelling method for periods of 1-4 weeks in dogs. Results of the SVC indwelling method showed that platelet accumulation on H+ and O2+ implanted specimens decreased. In particular 1 x 10(17) O2+/cm2 implantation caused both accumulation onto specimens and the SVC to decrease. Macroscopic views of the ion-implanted IVC specimens in dogs revealed little thrombus formation. It is concluded that ion implantation into silicone rod is a useful technique to improve its antithrombogenicity.
C1 RIKEN,INST PHYS & CHEM RES,SAITAMA 35101,JAPAN.
   TOKYO WOMENS MED COLL,DEPT RADIOL,DIV NUCL MED,SHINJUKU KU,TOKYO 162,JAPAN.

   DEWANJEE MK, 1982, RADIOLOGY, V145, P149
   ELMAN BS, 1981, PHYS REV B, V24, P1027, DOI 10.1103/PhysRevB.24.1027
   FLETCHER R, 1963, COMPUT J, V6, P163
   IWAKI M, 1989, CRIT REV SOLID STATE, V15, P473, DOI 10.1080/10408438908243743

TI ESR-SPECTRA OF PARA-SUBSTITUTED ALKYLBENZENE AND ALKENYLBENZENE RADICAL
   CATIONS IN HALOCARBON MATRICES
SO ZEITSCHRIFT FUR NATURFORSCHUNG SECTION A-A JOURNAL OF PHYSICAL SCIENCES
LA English
DT Article
ID ELECTRON-SPIN-RESONANCE; BENZENE CATIONS; RADIOLYSIS
AB The ESR spectra of several para-substituted alkyl- and alkenylbenzene radical cations generated by Co-60 gamma-ray irradiation in halocarbon matrices at 77 K have been studied with the aid of semiempirical MO calculations. It has been found that the ethyl conformation of 1,4-diethylbenzene radical cation (1,4-DEB+.) in CCl2FCClF2 is largely different from that in CCl3CF3. Further the ethyl and n-propyl groups in 4-ethyltoluene and 4-n-propyltoluene radical cations in CCl2FCClF2 take different conformations from that of 1,4-DEB+.. The conformations of the radical cations depend strongly both on the matrices and on the substituent groups. A peculiar radiolytical reaction of 1,4-diisopropylbenzene to a deprotonation-type neutral radical in CCl2FCClF2 has been found, similarly to the case of photolysis.

TI A-AXIS-ORIENTED YBA2CU3O7/PRBA2CU3O7 SUPERLATTICES - GROWTH AND
   TRANSPORT-PROPERTIES
SO JOURNAL OF ALLOYS AND COMPOUNDS
LA English
DT Article
ID HIGH-TC SUPERCONDUCTORS; THIN-FILMS; YBA2CU3O7-X/PRBA2CU3O7-X
   SUPERLATTICES; SINGLE-CRYSTALS; CRITICAL-FIELD; YBA2CU3O7-DELTA
AB Recent results on the growth of a-axis-oriented YBa2Cu3O7/PrBa2Cu3O7 superlattices and their transport properties are reported. The films have extremely smooth surfaces and a high crystalline quality as revealed by X-ray, transmission electron microscopy and Rutherford-backscattering spectroscopy analysis. When a magnetic field is applied in the plane of the substrate, it is found that the resistive transitions of superlattices containing individual YBa2Cu3O7 layers 24 or 48 angstrom thick separated by PrBa2Cu3O7 layers 24 or 48 angstrom thick show a cross-over at a temperature T* which depends on the PrBa2Cu3O7 thickness; above T* the transition is insensitive to magnetic fields up to 8 T; below T* some broadening occurs. These results are related to an abrupt disappearance of the coupling between the YBa2Cu3O7 Channels in the structure above T*.
RP TRISCONE, JM (reprint author), STANFORD UNIV,DEPT APPL PHYS,STANFORD,CA 94305, USA.

TI SEARCH FOR NEUTRINO-INDUCED LOW-ENERGY-ELECTRON-EVENT CLUSTERS IN
   KAMIOKANDE-II
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW D
LA English
DT Article
ID DETECTOR
AB Following earlier searches by the Kamiokande-II Collaboration for neutrino-induced events of special interest, a further intensive search has been made for electron events in the energy interval 6 less-than-or-equal-to E(e) less-than-or-equal-to 30 MeV, which are clustered in time. No time cluster which might be interpreted as a neutrino burst was found in 2.8 Yr of data apart from the burst from SN 1987A. An unusual group of events, not the result of a neutrino interaction in the detector, but clustered in time and space within the detector was observed; information concerning it is presented here.

TI HOMEOSTASIS AS REGULATED BY ACTIVATED MACROPHAGE .6. PROTECTIVE EFFECT
   OF LPSW (A LIPOPOLYSACCHARIDE FROM WHEAT-FLOUR) AGAINST ACUTE INFECTION
   BY TOXOPLASMA-GONDII IN MICE
SO CHEMICAL & PHARMACEUTICAL BULLETIN
LA English
DT Article
DE TOXOPLASMA-GONDII; MACROPHAGE; LIPOPOLYSACCHARIDE (LPS); LPSW;
   TOXOPLASMOSIS; HOMEOSTASIS
ID TUMOR NECROSIS FACTOR; INTERFERON-GAMMA; ENDOGENOUS PRODUCTION;
   IFN-GAMMA; T-CELLS; RESISTANCE; INVITRO; LYT-2+; INVIVO; MOUSE
AB An oral administration of partially purified LPSw, a lipopolysaccharide (LPS) from wheat flour, at a concentration of 20ng/ml in drinking water beginning 1d after infection significantly decreased mouse mortality and prevented animal weight loss in acute infection with Toxoplasma gondii. Whereas 71% (5/7) of mice in a control group that did not receive LPSw died of toxoplasmosis, only 14% (1/7) of mice treated with LPSw died (p<0.05). The administration of LPS purified from Bordetella pertussis also significantly decreased the mortality of infected mice. LPS from Escherichia coli and synthetic lipid A (LA-15-PP(506)), however, did not show a significant decrease in mortality.
C1 TEIKYO UNIV,BIOTECHNOL RES CTR,NOGAWA,MIYAMAE KU,KAWASAKI 216,JAPAN.

TI THE REACTION OF ALPHA-TRIBUTYLSTANNYLTHIOACETALS WITH ENOL
   TRIMETHYLSILYL ETHERS - PREPARATION OF
   BETA-TRIBUTYLSTANNYL-ALPHA,BETA-UNSATURATED KETONES
SO CHEMISTRY LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
AB The tin(IV) chloride-promoted reaction of enol trimethylsilyl ethers with alpha-tributylstannylthioacetals gave beta-phenylthio-beta-tributylstannylketones, which were easily transformed to beta-tributylstannyl-alpha, beta-unsaturated ketones (3) by the treatment with potassium hydride or DBU.  On the basis of the results obtained in the study of the reaction of 3 with copper(II) bromide, it was assumed that the present reaction gave Z-isomers predominantly.

TI THE STABILITY AND REACTIVITY OF DIHYDROXY
   BIS(TRIMETHYLPHOSPHINE)PLATINUM(II)
SO CHEMISTRY LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID COMPLEXES
AB A dihydroxy platinum(II) compound, cis-[Pt(PMe3)2(OH)2].nH2O (Me = methyl, n = 2-3; 1) has been isolated.  The presence of several water molecules is required for the stabilization of the complex.  The solution equilibria of 1 with some equivalents of nitric acid has been observed by P-31 NMR spectroscopy, as well as the reaction of 1 with aqueous hydrogen peroxide.  Leaving 1 in air gives carbonatoplatinum(II), cis-[Pt(PMe3)2(CO3)].2H2O.  The crystal structure determination has revealed that the carbonate anion forms a 4-membered chelate with a platinum atom.
RP MIYAMOTO, TK (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,FAC SCI,DEPT CHEM,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.
CR APPLETON TG, 1989, INORG CHEM, V28, P1989, DOI 10.1021/ic00309a044

TI A 622-MB/S MONOLITHICALLY INTEGRATED INGAAS/INP 4-CHANNEL P-I-N FET
   RECEIVER ARRAY
SO IEEE PHOTONICS TECHNOLOGY LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
AB We describe the sensitivity and crosstalk characteristics of a long-wavelength monolithically integrated four-channel photoreceiver army. This receiver consists of 4 p-i-n PD's, 24 JFET's and 28 level-shift diodes. The device is fabricated using MOVPE grown crystals and Be ion implantation technique. The receiver chip demonstrates a sensitivity of between -30.6 and -31.4 dBm, crosstalk below -20 dB over its operating frequency range. Sensitivity deterioration due to crosstalk, which is demonstrated for the first time, is shown to be a critical factor in system performance. The crosstalk is mainly due to parasitic inductances on the external power supply circuits.
C1 NIPPON TELEGRAPH & TEL PUBL CORP,YOKOSUKA ELECT COMMUN LABS,TRANSMISS SYST LABS,YOKOSUKA,KANAGAWA 23803,JAPAN.

TI A MONOLITHIC 3-CHANNEL LD-PD ARRAY WITH VERTICALLY STAGGERED FACETS FOR
   AUTOFOCUSING REFLECTIVITY SENSORS
SO IEEE PHOTONICS TECHNOLOGY LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
AB A monolithic three-channel LD-PD array with vertically staggered facets is proposed for an autofocusing reflectivity sensor which uses light feedback. The focus-sensing characteristics are investigated using an array with a radiation facet displacement of 12-mu-m and an interchannel distance of 130-mu-m, fabricated on an 830-nm AlGaAs/GaAs multiple quantum-well laser substrate with buried-heterostructure stripe geometry wave-guides. High focus-sensing accuracy is achieved. A potential application of the array to optical heads for phase change media is discussed.

TI PERFORMANCE OF URANIUM-PLUTONIUM MIXED CARBIDE FUELS IRRADIATED TO LOW
   BURNUP
SO JOURNAL OF THE ATOMIC ENERGY SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA Japanese
DT Article
DE POSTIRRADIATION EXAMINATION; URANIUM; PLUTONIUM; MIXED CARBIDE FUELS;
   FBR-TYPE REACTORS; PORE DISTRIBUTION; GRAIN GROWTH; RESTRUCTURING;
   CRACKING; FISSION PRODUCT RELEASE; GAMMA-SPECTROMETRY; CARBURIZATION
AB Four pins of U-Pu mixed carbide fuel, which is one of potential advanced fuels for FBRs, were irradiated in JRR-2 up to burn-ups of 1.5% FIMA without any pin failure. In spite of irradiations at relatively low linear heat powers of 42 and 64 kW/m, the change in the sizes of pores and grain size was observed. Pellet density and carbon content appreciably influenced to irradiation fuel performance, such as restructuring, cracking and FP gas release. It was revealed in the gamma-spectrometry that Cs behaved similarly to FP gases and condensed at the plenum. A slight carburization was observed at the inside of 316 stainless steel cladding.
RP IWAI, T (reprint author), JAPAN ATOM ENERGY RES INST,TAKASAKI,GUNMA 37012,JAPAN.

TI THE RECYCLING SYSTEM OF CHROMIUM(VI) IN WASTE-WATER CONTAINING CHROMIUM
   BY ION-EXCHANGE RESIN
SO NIPPON KAGAKU KAISHI
LA Japanese
DT Article
AB A study was accomplished over recycling system of chromium(VI) in wastewater from the plants handling chromium(VI) by ion exchange resin.
   An anion exchange resin selectively adsorbing chromium(VI) was adopted in the Cl-form to prevent from the hydroxide precipitation owing to the rise in pH during treatment.
   Effects of pH and Cl-, SO42-, Cr(III) contents in treated water on adsorption of chromium (VI), and differences between one bed method and two beds method were investigated to develop a process, which can adsorb chromium(VI) to an ion exchange resin effectively and perfectly.
   With a centralized regenerating process in industrial scale, the resins are perfectly regenerated and the chromium(VI) solution with high content and low impurity is recovered. This solution can be recycled as the raw material of chromium compounds.
C1 NIPPON DENKO CO LTD,KORIYAMA PLANT,KORIYAMA 96305,JAPAN.

AU SUZUKI, Y
AF SUZUKI, Y
TI FUTURE PERSPECTIVES AND STEPS TO ACHIEVE A LEASED CIRCUIT SERVICE OF ONE
   MILLION CIRCUITS
SO NTT REVIEW
LA English
DT Article
AB This article will summarize future trends among the leased circuit services provided by NTT, concentrating on the high-speed digital leased circuit services that are the core of private corporate networks. In introducing modern digital services for leased circuit services, it is necessary to consider next two major points. One point is for private corporate networks for large business customers, which are becoming larger in scale and able to cover wider areas. These networks are also becoming more complex due to their use of multi-media information sources and multi-vendor supplied equipment or facilities. The other point is for customers, who want to introduce digital technology themselves, and in doing so, generate their own information by digital processing.
   In this article, we propose the introduction of new service concepts into leased circuit services market, corresponding to new digital-oriented environment. We also describe examples of some new services, and systems enabling the provision of those services.
RP SUZUKI, Y (reprint author), NIPPON TELEGRAPH & TEL PUBL CORP,DEPT LEASED CIRCUIT,1-6 UCHISHIWAI CHO,I CHOME,CHIYODA KU,TOKYO 100,JAPAN.

TI MODULATED PHOTOREGULATION OF LIQUID-CRYSTAL ALIGNMENT BY AZOBENZENE
   LANGMUIR-BLODGETT LAYERS - REVERSIBLE ALIGNMENT CHANGES OF
   LIQUID-CRYSTALS INDUCED BY PHOTOCHROMIC MOLECULAR FILMS .11.
SO THIN SOLID FILMS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON LANGMUIR-BLODGETT FILMS
CY AUG 26-30, 1991
CL PARIS, FRANCE
ID SIDE-CHAINS; DEPOSITION; MONOLAYERS
AB In-plane homogeneous alignment controls of a liquid crystal on photochromic azobenzene (Az) Langmuir-Blodgett layers are investigated. A nematic liquid crystal takes the parallel (planar) alignment with the cis-Az surface. In this mode LC molecules are oriented parallel to the dipping direction when the deposition number is more than 3. Under particular conditions a linearly polarized UV light induces subsequent in-plane reorientation of the LC molecules, the reorientation direction being perpendicular to the polarization plane.

TI OBSERVATION OF A SMALL ATMOSPHERIC NU-MU/NU-E RATIO IN KAMIOKANDE
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID SOLAR-NEUTRINO DATA; FLUX; OSCILLATIONS; SEARCH
AB Results are presented of the observation of atmospheric neutrino interactions in the Kamiokande detector in an exposure of 4.92 kt yr.  The observed ratio of single ring-mu-events to e-events (mu/e)data/(mu/e)MC = 0.60-(0.06)+007 (stat.) +/- 0.05 (syst.) suggests that the atmosphere nu(mu)/nu(e) ratio is smaller than expected.  The implications of these results for neutrino oscillations are discussed.

TI FABRICATION AND EVALUATION OF X-RAY MULTILAYER MIRRORS PREPARED BY
   LASER-INDUCED CHEMICAL VAPOR-DEPOSITION
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
DE PHOTOCHEMICAL VAPOR DEPOSITION; X-RAY DIFFRACTION; MULTILAYER; TUNGSTEN
   CARBON; EXCIMER LASER; SYNCHROTRON RADIATION; TRANSMISSION ELECTRON
   MICROSCOPY
ID TUNGSTEN-CARBON MULTILAYERS; OPTICS
AB This study demonstrates a new preparation process for fabricating X-ray multilayer mirrors. Tungsten/carbon multilayer mirrors were prepared using laser-induced chemical vapor deposition (laser-CVD). The structure and properties of the mirror were examined using X-ray diffraction, synchrotron radiation and transmission electron microscopy (TEM) measurements. The reflectivity at a grazing angle of 14.5 degrees was observed to be 4.1% at a wavelength of 5 nm. The reflectivity was lower than the ideal reflectivity. The reduction in the reflectivity was caused by the lower-density film (tungsten layer), interface roughness and diffuse interfaces. Furthermore, after annealing at room temperature for two months, the increment of the period of this mirror was about 33%. This was due to the oxidation of tungsten films in W/C (tungsten/carbon multilayer mirror).
C1 JAPAN RES DEV CORP,ERTO,YOSHIDA NANO MECHANISM PROJECT,TOKYO,TOKYO 140,JAPAN.
CR Barbee T. W., 1981, AIP C P, V75, P131

TI NEGATIVE-ION PRODUCTION IN A LARGE SEMICYLINDRICAL ION-SOURCE
SO REVIEW OF SCIENTIFIC INSTRUMENTS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON ION SOURCES ( ICIS 91 )
CY SEP 30-OCT 04, 1991
CL BENSHEIM, GERMANY
SP GESELL SCHWERIONENFORSCH, DEUT FORSCHUNGSGEMEINSCH, BALZERS, AMER PHYS SOC, AMER VACUUM SOC, DEUT PHYS GESELL, EUROPEAN PHYS SOC, INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS
AB A large semicylindrical negative ion source, whose dimensions are 34 cm in diameter and 104 cm in length, has been developed.  By optimizing a chamber depth and a filter strength, a H- current of 650 mA (7.7 mA/cm2) was obtained at an arc condition of 1.3 Pa, 70 V, and 1200 A.  In order to increase the H- current and to reduce an operating pressure, a small amount of Cs was injected.  As a result, the H- current was increased from 550 mA (6.5 mA/cm2) to 850 mA (10 mA/cm2) under an arc power of 70 V x 800 A.  The most significant feature of the cesium effect was the reduction of the operating pressure.  With maintaining the sufficient current of 670 mA (8 mA/cm2), the operating pressure could be lowered to 0.03 Pa.  At this pressure, the highest gas efficiency of 20% was achieved.
RP HANADA, M (reprint author), JAPAN ATOM ENERGY RES INST,NAKA,IBARAKI 31101,JAPAN.
CR HANADA M, 1990, REV SCI INSTRUM, V61, P499, DOI 10.1063/1.1141233

TI LONG PULSE OPERATION OF A CESIUM-SEEDED MULTICUSP H- ION-SOURCE
SO REVIEW OF SCIENTIFIC INSTRUMENTS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON ION SOURCES ( ICIS 91 )
CY SEP 30-OCT 04, 1991
CL BENSHEIM, GERMANY
SP GESELL SCHWERIONENFORSCH, DEUT FORSCHUNGSGEMEINSCH, BALZERS, AMER PHYS SOC, AMER VACUUM SOC, DEUT PHYS GESELL, EUROPEAN PHYS SOC, INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS
AB It is demonstrated that a cesium-seeded volume H- ion source can be operated very stably for long pulse durations of up to 24 h.  The source consists of a 20 cm cylindrical multicusp plasma generator and a 9 cm x 10 cm multiaperture extractor.  By seeding a small amount of cesium, the source has produced 50 keV, 0.5 A, 1000 s H- ion beams with a current density of 14 mA/cm2.  The cesium effect lasted for more than 24 h once 100 mg cesium was seeded before operation.  Power flow measurement revealed that the heat loading of the ion source was low enough to operate the source in the dc mode.
RP OKUMURA, Y (reprint author), JAPAN ATOM ENERGY RES INST,NAKA FUS RES ESTAB,NAKA,IBARAKI 31101,JAPAN.

TI MEAN MOLAL ACTIVITY-COEFFICIENTS OF AQUEOUS SCANDIUM CHLORIDE, NITRATE,
   BROMIDE AND PERCHLORATE SOLUTIONS AT 25.0-DEGREES-C
SO JOURNAL OF ALLOYS AND COMPOUNDS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 19TH CONF ON RARE EARTH RESEARCH
CY JUL 14-19, 1991
CL LEXINGTON, KY
SP UNIV KENTUCKY, RARE EARTH RES CONF
ID EARTH ELECTROLYTE-SOLUTIONS; ISOPIESTIC DETERMINATION; OSMOTIC
   COEFFICIENTS; HYDRATION NUMBER; 25-DEGREES-C; 25DEGREESC; IONS
AB The mean molal activity coefficients of aqueous scandium chloride, nitrate, bromide and perchlorate solutions were determined at 25.0-degrees-C for dilute to saturated concentrations, together with the activities of water. In the dilute solutions of scandium halides, the activity coefficients were obtained from electromotive force measurements on galvanic cells, and the osmotic coefficients of all four solutions above 0.1 mol kg-1 were determined from the isopiestic measurements. Least-squares equations were fitted to these coefficients, which were then used to calculate the mean molal activity coefficients and water activities. The relationships between these results and the corresponding activity data for other rare earth salts, and to the cation hydration and ionic interactions, are discussed. The results on scandium perchlorate solutions suggested that the inner-sphere hydration number of tervalent scandium ion may be seven.
RP SUZUKI, Y (reprint author), MEIJI UNIV,DEPT IND CHEM,TAMA KU,KAWASAKI 214,JAPAN.

TI REACTION-MECHANISM OF LI-11 AT INTERMEDIATE ENERGY
SO NUCLEAR PHYSICS A
LA English
DT Article
ID REACTION CROSS-SECTIONS; ELASTIC-SCATTERING; NUCLEUS LI-11; BREAKUP;
   MODEL; FRAGMENTATION; CHANNELS
AB The reaction of Li-11, a nucleus characterized by a halo structure, is analyzed by the (Li-9 + n + n)-target four-body model in the intermediate energy region.  The eikonal approximation and adiabatic approximation are employed not only to make the microscopic calculation feasible but to get intuitive pictures for the reaction mechanism.  To test the accuracy of the eikonal approximation in the intermediate energy region, the deuteron reaction is also analyzed by the (p + n)-target three-body model and compared with the coupled discretized continuum-channels analysis.  It is found that the eikonal approximation works quite successfully for various reaction mechanisms including the break-up process.  The total reaction cross section and the two-neutron removal cross section of the Li-11 + C-12 reaction are analyzed.  The measured interaction cross section is nicely reproduced in our calculation.  It is found that the elastic break-up process plays an important role in the intermediate energy region.
C1 NIIGATA UNIV,GRAD SCH SCI & TECHNOL,NIIGATA 95021,JAPAN.
RP YABANA, K (reprint author), NIIGATA UNIV,DEPT PHYS,NIIGATA 95021,JAPAN.

TI A LIMIT ON SPONTANEOUS R-PARITY BREAKING FROM KAMIOKANDE
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID SEARCH; FLUX
AB If R parity is not an exact symmetry in supersymmetric theories, the lightest supersymmetric partner, most favorably the neutralino, would not be stable, but may decay to produce energetic neutrinos.  We show that a lack of excess neutrino events above the atmospheric neutrino background, obtained from upward-going muon data in Kamiokande, places a severe constraint on models of R parity breaking if the neutralino is a dark-matter particle.

TI FORMATION OF BETA-GALACTOSYL COMPOUNDS OF PYRIDOXINE IN GROWING CULTURE
   OF SPOROBOLOMYCES-SINGULARIS
SO BIOCHIMICA ET BIOPHYSICA ACTA
LA English
DT Article
DE PYRIDOXINE 5'-BETA-GALACTOSIDE; PYRIDOXINE 4'-BETA-GALACTOSIDE;
   PYRIDOXINE 4'-BETA-GALACTOBIOSIDE; (S-SINGULARIS)
ID RICE BRAN; VITAMIN-B6; IDENTIFICATION; GLUCOSIDE; FOODS; FORM
AB Several pyridoxine compounds were found to be formed in a high yield in a growing culture of Sporobolomyces singularis containing lactose and pyridoxine.  Three compounds, I, II and III, were isolated from cultured broth by Dowex 50W-X8 column chromatography, paper chromatography, lyophilization, and then obtained as needle crystals (m.p. (decomp.):  I, 204-206-degrees-C; II, 192-194-degrees-C; III, 222-223-degrees-C.  [Alpha]D16:  I, -27.7-degrees (c = 3.82, H2O); II, -1.6-degrees (c = 2.52, H2O); III, +8.3-degrees (c = 3.98, H2O)).  Compounds I, II and III were identified as 5'-O-(beta-D-galactopyranosyl)-pyridoxine, 4'-O-(beta-D-galactopyranosyl)-pyridoxine, and 4'-O-(beta-D-galactopyranosyl-(1 --> 4)-beta-D-galactopyranosyl)-pyridoxine, respectively, on the basis of the various experimental results, viz., ultraviolet, infra-red, H-1-NMR, and C-13-NMR spectra, products by hydrolysis with acid and with alpha- and beta-galactosidases, migration on paper electrophoresis, and Gibbs reaction in the presence and absence of boric acid.  Also, the yeast produced a remarkable amount of beta-glucosyl compounds of pyridoxine in cultured broth, when grown on cellobiose and pyridoxine.
RP SUZUKI, Y (reprint author), OKAYAMA UNIV,BIORESOURCES RES INST,KURASHIKI 710,JAPAN.
CR GREGORY JF, 1987, J AGR FOOD CHEM, V35, P76, DOI 10.1021/jf00073a018

TI COLOR-CHANGE OF NEW COCCINE IN A LYSOZYME ALIMEZINE TRIMETOQUINOL SYRUP
   - OPTICAL SPECTROSCOPIC AND KINETIC ANALYSES
SO CHEMICAL & PHARMACEUTICAL BULLETIN
LA English
DT Article
DE NEW COCCINE; ALIMEZINE; LYSOZYME; TRIMETOQUINOL; SODIUM SULFITE;
   ABSORPTION SPECTRUM; CD SPECTRUM; THERMODYNAMIC PARAMETER
ID CIBACRON BLUE; CONGO RED; PROTEINS
AB A color change of New coccine in an alimezine syrup after the mixing of commercial alimezine, lysozyme and trimetoquinol syrups was studied by means of spectroscopic methods.  No color change of New coccine in the alimezine syrup was observed by an addition of either lysozyme or trimetoquinol syrup.  Yet both lysozyme and trimetoquinol were required for drastic changes in absorption and circular dichroism spectra of New coccine.  From these spectral changes, it was considered that the color change of New coccine resulted from the binding of New coccine to lysozyme.  In this case, it seems that New coccine molecules are placed in a hydrophobic lysozymal region with a specific configuration.  Since the color change was observed also by a mixing of pure New coccine, lysozyne and sodium sulfite, the color change of the admixture mentioned above likely resulted from the addition of sulfite groups to New coccine molecules.  Sodium sulfite is contained in commercial syrups as a stabilizer.  From the thermodynamic parameters calculated from the spectral changes, a possible role of lysozyme in the color change of New coccine was demonstrated.  The values of the parameters suggest also that lysozyme fixes New coccine molecules in a specific conformation.
C1 TOHOKU UNIV,INST PHARMACEUT,AOBA KU,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.

TI OPTICAL AND THERMAL-PROPERTIES OF SULFUR-PERTURBED F-2(+) CENTERS IN
   NACL AS THE LASER ACTIVE-CENTER
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
DE OPTICAL ABSORPTION; LUMINESCENCE; SULFUR-PERTURBED F-2(+) CENTER; NACL;
   COLOR CENTER LASER; THERMAL STABILITY
ID COLOR-CENTER LASER; ALKALI-HALIDE CRYSTALS; ADDITIVE-PULSE; DOPED NACL;
   OH LASER; OPERATION; KCL
AB The optimum sample preparation, optical properties, and stability against light and heat for sulfur-perturbed F2+ centers (F2+:S--) in NaCl have been investigated to determine the potential quality as a laser material. F2+:S--'s were introduced into NaCl doped with Na2S by additive coloration and subsequent photoaggregation. Absorption and luminescence bands occurred at 1.18 and 0.832 eV at 80 K, respectively. The excitation spectra for the luminescence showed two maxima at 1.18 and 2.71 eV.  The luminescence efficiency was 0.84 +/- 0.03 between 80 and 290 K. Photoexcitation of the F2+ center in F2+:S-- to the 2p-pi(u) state at 80 K converted the configuration of F2+:S-- into the most compact form, and also rotated the F2+ axis by 60-degrees, while the photoexcitation above about 190 K destroyed F2+:S--. F2+:S-- was expected to be stable for approximately 19 days at 290 K, and approximately 400 days at 268 K in the dark.

TI REVERSIBLE ALIGNMENT CHANGE OF LIQUID-CRYSTALS INDUCED BY PHOTOCHROMIC
   MOLECULAR FILMS .13. FACTORS AFFECTING PHOTOINDUCED ALIGNMENT REGULATION
   OF CYCLOHEXANECARBOXYLATE-TYPE NEMATIC LIQUID-CRYSTALS BY AZOBENZENE
   MOLECULAR FILMS
SO LANGMUIR
LA English
DT Article
ID PHASE-TRANSITION; COMMAND SURFACES; ORIENTATION
AB Azobenzene units attached on quartz plates through Si-O bonding exhibit reversible photoisomerization and regulate the alignment of a nematic liquid crystal (LC) between homeotropic and planar modes when LC cells are constructed by putting the LC between two plates covered with the azo-modified surfaces which have been called "command surfaces". The efficiency of the command surfaces is affected crucially by the molecular structure and the occupied area of azobenzene unit. Concerning the molecular structural effect, the hydrophobic nature of a substituent at the azobenzene moiety holds an important role in the alignment regulation. The mode of silylation and the length of a spacer unit between the azobenzene moiety and the silylating group are key factors in commanding the alignment regulation as well. There is a critical area occupied by an azobenzene unit for the photoregulation of LC alignment. An occupied area larger than ca. 120 angstrom2 results in no photoregulation. The occupied area also affects the photoresponse pattern, and discussion is given on the existence of a threshold of the command surface property for the photoregulation. Effects of cell thickness and the exposure cycles on the photoresponse are also presented.

TI PHOTO-REDUCTION OF FE (III) BY DISSOLVED ORGANIC-SUBSTANCES AND
   EXISTENCE OF FE (II) IN SEAWATER DURING SPRING BLOOMS
SO MARINE CHEMISTRY
LA English
DT Article
ID IRON; PHYTOPLANKTON; WATER; OXIDE
AB Fe(III) in seawater was readily reduced to Fe(II) in sunlight in the presence of hydroxycarboxylic acids, such as sugar acids.  Tartaric, gluconic, glucaric acids and glucaric acid-1,4-lactone gave higher reduced Fe(II) concentrations and a more rapid increase for a short illumination time than other acids.  The reduced Fe(II) concentration was found to be greater at 5-degrees-C than at 20-degrees-C.  In sunlight the reduction of Fe(III) in seawater occurred even at low concentration of the hydroxycarboxylic acids (1-mu-M).  From field observations, 0.02-0.04-mu-M of dissolved Fe(II) appeared in oxic surface seawater during spring blooms in Funka Bay (Japan) during 1987, 1988 and 1989 as a result of vertical water mixing by which Fe(III) from sediments was transported to the surface.  These observations may result from photo-reduction of Fe(III) in the presence of hydroxycarboxylic acids which were possibly released by phytoplankton during spring blooms.

TI FORMATION OF THE LARGE-SIZED CRYSTALS OF LEAD(II) SULFATE PRECIPITATE
   THROUGH THE STATIC REACTION OF PRECIPITATION FROM HOMOGENEOUS SOLUTION
   METHOD WITH SULFAMIC ACID
SO NIPPON KAGAKU KAISHI
LA Japanese
DT Article
AB The formation of large-sized crystals of lead(II) sulfate precipitate was examined by using an optical microscope, a scanning electron microscope, X-ray powder diffraction method, energy dispersive X-ray analysis systems and a thermal analysis.  The morphology of crystals formed in this experiment was compared with that previously formed in the stirring reaction.
   Lead(II) sulfate was precipitated through the static reaction of the precipitation from homogeneous solution (PFHS) method on the reaction time (0.5 approximately 6.0 h), by using lead(II) nitrate (16.7 x 10(-3) M) and sulfamic acid (16.7 x 10(-3) M approximately 83.5 x 10(-3) M) aqueous solutions at 100-degrees-C.
   The thin layer plate of lozeng crystal which was smaller than 10-mu-m in the major axis appeared at the beginning of reaction and at low concentration of sulfamic acid (16.7 x 10(-3) M).  With continuing precipitation reaction, the former crystal grew quickly longer than 200-mu-m, and then the shape of them was transformed from thin hexagonal plate longer than 250-mu-m to thick hexagonal plate longer than 300-mu-m.
   At higher concentration of sulfamic acid and long reaction time, the growth steps of the crystals went through very rapidly, and finally, these crystals grew to rectangular octahedron crystal from 230-mu-m to larger than 300-mu-m by the crystal habit.  And, these crystals were much larger than the crystal of 120-mu-m obtained by the stirring reaction in the major axis and the volume of particles.  Besides, they were the single crystals and had smooth surfaces.
   The strongest X-ray diffraction lines of the lattice planes of the precipitates obtained through almost all of the precipitation reaction appeared at (002) plane of the planar growth plane which was based on the selective orientation of crystal, and the appearance of such a plane did not change in spite of the increase in concentrations of sulfamic acid and reaction times.

TI ENDOTHELIAL-CELL ADHESION TO ION-IMPLANTED POLYMERS
SO NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION B-BEAM
   INTERACTIONS WITH MATERIALS AND ATOMS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 6TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON RADIATION EFFECTS IN INSULATORS
CY JUN 24-28, 1991
CL WEIMER, GERMANY
ID POLYSTYRENE; CARBON
AB The biocompatibility of ion implanted polymers has been studied by means of adhesion measurements of bovine aorta endothelial cells in vitro.  The specimens used were polystyrene (PS) and segmented polyurethane (SPU).  Na+, N2+, O2+ and Kr+ ion implantations were performed at an energy of 150 keV with fluences ranging from 1 x 10(15) to 3 x 10(17) ions/cm2 at room temperature.  The chemical and physical structures of ion-implanted polymers have been investigated in order to analyze their tissue compatibility such as improvement of endothelial cell adhesion.  The ion implanted SPU have been found to exhibit remarkably higher adhesion and spreading of endothelial cells than unimplanted specimens.  By contrast, ion implanted PS demonstrated a little improvement of adhesion of cells in this assay.  Results of FT-IR-ATR showed that ion implantation broke the original chemical bond to form new radicals such as OH, Bond C C = O, SiH and condensed rings.  The results of Raman spectroscopy showed that ion implantation always produced a peak near 1500 cm-1, which indicated that these ion implanted PS and SPU had the same carbon structure.  This structure is considered to bring the dramatic increase in the extent of cell adhesion and spreading to these ion implanted PS and SPU.
C1 RIKEN INST PHYS & CHEM RES,WAKO,SAITAMA 35101,JAPAN.

TI QUASI-ELASTIC-LIGHT-SCATTERING STUDY OF THE MOVEMENT OF PARTICLES IN
   GELS - TOPOLOGICAL-STRUCTURE OF PORES IN GELS
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID DIFFUSION; PROBE
AB A quasielastic-light-scattering study of polystyrene latex particles embedded inside a random system (in this case, polyacrylamide solutions and gels) was carried out.  By measuring the correlation functions of the scattered-light intensity from suspended probe particles, structures of pores in gels were characterized.  In the vicinity of the gelation threshold, the movement of particles in the gel may be quite different from normal diffusion, because of the interference from polymer networks.  In this report the relation between the diffusion process and the correlation length of the system is discussed.  The characteristic exponent of the topological structure of pores in gels at the threshold is also estimated.
RP SUZUKI, Y (reprint author), AOYAMA GAKUIN UNIV,COLL SCI & ENGN,DEPT PHYS,TOKYO 157,JAPAN.

TI A HUMAN GENE RESPONSIBLE FOR ZELLWEGER SYNDROME THAT AFFECTS PEROXISOME
   ASSEMBLY
SO SCIENCE
LA English
DT Article
ID DISORDERS; COMPLEMENTATION; HETEROGENEITY; BIOGENESIS; GHOSTS; DNA
AB The primary defect arising from Zellweger syndrome appears to be linked to impaired assembly of peroxisomes. A human complementary DNA has been cloned that complements the disease's symptoms (including defective peroxisome assembly) in fibroblasts from a patient with Zellweger syndrome. The cause of the syndrome in this patient was a point mutation that resulted in the premature termination of peroxisome assembly factor-1. The homozygous patient apparently inherited the mutation from her parents, each of whom was heterozygous for that mutation.

AF SEKINE, T

TI RATE OF BACK-EXTRACTION OF TRIS(ACETYLACETONATO)CHROMIUM(III) AND
   TRIS(TRIFLUOROACETYLACETONATO)CHROMIUM(III) FROM CARBON-TETRACHLORIDE
   INTO AQUEOUS ACID PERCHLORATE SOLUTIONS
SO BULLETIN OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
ID SOLVENT-EXTRACTION; METAL-COMPLEXES; CHROMIUM(III); ACETYLACETONE
AB The rate of back-extraction of tris(acetylacetonato)chromium(III) ([Cr(acac)3]), and tris(trifluoroacetylacetonato)chromium(III) ([Cr(tfa)3]), from carbon tetrachloride into aqueous acid perchlorate solutions was measured. The rate of [Cr(acac)3] was much higher and that of [Cr(tfa)3] was also a little higher in the higher acid concentration range. This was concluded to be due to formation of the [Cr(acac)3(H+)2] and the [Cr(tfa)3H+] species which increased the concentration of the tris-complex species in the aqueous phase.  With the both complexes, the rate was not affected by the ligand concentration in the aqueous phase. From these results, the controlling reaction was concluded to be the dissociation of the first ligand from the tris-complex or from the proton associate of the tris-complex in the aqueous phase.
RP SEKINE, T (reprint author), SCI UNIV TOKYO,DEPT CHEM,SHINJUKU KU,TOKYO 162,JAPAN.

TI A CALORIMETER FOR MU-W LEVEL OPTICAL POWER TRANSFER STANDARD
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON INSTRUMENTATION AND MEASUREMENT
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 8TH ANNUAL CONF ON THE INSTRUMENTATION AND MEASUREMENT TECHNOLOGY (
   IMTC/91 )
CY MAY 14-16, 1991
CL ATLANTA, GA
SP IEEE, INSTRUMENTAT MEASUREMENT SOC, IEEE, ATLANTA SECTION
AB A calorimeter which can measure mu-W level optical power has been developed for an optical power transfer standard.  It can measure the optical power of a light beam, and can be used with optical fiber simply by attaching an adapter.  This calorimeter sensor uses a compensative absorber to reduce the influence of pressure fluctuation and temperature variation in the measurement room and an ultra-low-noise preamplifier.  With this calorimeter, the standard deviation of the measured value is in the range of 0.02-0.4% in 20 mW to 10-mu-W optical power measurements.  An error evaluation for an optical power level of 10-mu-W yielded a two-sigma (two standard deviation) total uncertainty of 0.9%.
RP SUZUKI, Y (reprint author), YOKOGAWA ELECT CORP,YAMANASHI 400,JAPAN.

TI A METHOD OF IMPROVING THE RESOLUTION AND ACCURACY OF ROTARY ENCODERS
   USING A CODE COMPENSATION TECHNIQUE
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON INSTRUMENTATION AND MEASUREMENT
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 8TH ANNUAL CONF ON THE INSTRUMENTATION AND MEASUREMENT TECHNOLOGY (
   IMTC/91 )
CY MAY 14-16, 1991
CL ATLANTA, GA
SP IEEE, INSTRUMENTAT MEASUREMENT SOC, IEEE, ATLANTA SECTION
AB A method of improving the resolution and accuracy of incremental type rotary encoders using a phase encoding and code compensation system is described.  Applying this system to an optical incremental encoder whose scale pitch is 1/3600 rotation, its resolution is improved up to 1/920,000 rotation, and better than +/- 1/300,000 rotation (+/- 0.0012-degrees) precision is obtained.

TI FLUX-DENSITY DISTRIBUTION IN DISK-SHAPED SUPERCONDUCTING THIN-FILMS
   DETERMINED USING IRON-GARNET FILMS
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article
AB The flux penetration in superconducting YBa2Cu3Ox films has been observed by means of the magneto-optical Faraday effect in iron garnet films. Bi- and Ga-substituted YIG films were used for the observation of the flux density distribution for the disk-shaped YBa2Cu3Ox films. We estimated the superconducting current density distribution profiles from the flux density distribution.

TI MAGNETOOPTICAL KERR ROTATION SPECTRA IN ORDERED AND DISORDERED PHASES OF
   FE-PT ALLOY-FILMS
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MAGNETISM
CY SEP 02-06, 1991
CL EDINBURGH, SCOTLAND
ID MULTILAYERED FILMS; CO/PT; ANISOTROPY
AB The magneto-optical Kerr rotation (theta(K)) spectra and the related properties have been measured in ordered and disordered phases of several kinds of Fe-Pt alloy films.  The \theta(K)\ in as-deposited (disordered) films becomes gradually larger with increasing Fe content until about 50 at% Fe, but the shape of theta(K) spectra does not change so much.  After annealing, however, all the theta(K) spectra were changed.  A considerable change of the theta(K) spectra near 300 nm, which would be expected by the anti-parallel alighment of the polarized Pt spins to Fe spins after annealing, was not observed in the films with approx. 50 at% Fe.
C1 TWENTE UNIV TECHNOL,7500 AE ENSCHEDE,NETHERLANDS.

TI NMR-STUDY OF FCC CO/CU(100) AND CO/CU(111) ARTIFICIAL SUPERLATTICES
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MAGNETISM
CY SEP 02-06, 1991
CL EDINBURGH, SCOTLAND
AB Spin echo spectra of Co-59 nuclei in fcc Co/Cu superlattices were investigated.  The superlattices were prepared using the UHV deposition technique (10(-9) Torr during deposition).  (111) and (100) stacking structures were performed using Si(111) and MgO(100) single-crystal substrates.  The samples are essentially single crystals, but there are many stacking faults in the (111) oriented samples.  NMR spectra consist of some distinct lines corresponding to several local environments of Co nuclei in the superlattices.  Intensity and position of those lines show clear differences between two orientations.  The (100) stacked superlattices have rather rough interfaces, while the (111) stacked superlattices show NMR spectra of fairly flat interfaces.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,INST PHYS SOLIDES,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.
RP SUZUKI, Y (reprint author), ELECTROTECH LAB,UMEZONO 1-1-4,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI TEMPERATURE-DEPENDENCE OF PERPENDICULAR MAGNETIC-ANISOTROPY IN CO/AU AND
   CO/PT MULTILAYERS
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MAGNETISM
CY SEP 02-06, 1991
CL EDINBURGH, SCOTLAND
ID FILM LAYERED STRUCTURES; SPIN ANISOTROPY; PD/CO
AB Temperature dependences of perpendicular magnetic anisotropy and saturation magnetization in Co/Au and Co/Pt multilayer films prepared by rf sputtering method were investigated.  The saturation magnetization, M(s), of the Co/Pt multilayer films is larger than M(s) of bulk Co at low temperatures.  Enhancement of M(s) is not observed in Co/Au multilayer films.  The magnetic anisotropy energy, K perpendicular-to eff, of Co/Au multilayer films increases greatly with decreasing temperature.  The K perpendicular-to eff at 5 K is four times as large as that at room temperature in the Co(4 angstrom)/Au(29.5 angstrom) multilayer film.  While K perpendicular-to eff in the Co/Pt multilayer films decreases with decreasing temperature.
C1 ELECTROTECH LAB,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.
RP SUGIMOTO, T (reprint author), NIHON UNIV,COLL SCI & TECHNOL,FUNABASHI,CHIBA 274,JAPAN.
RI SUZUKI, Yoshishige/D-2652-2013

TI EVALUATION OF HOT-WIRE MEASUREMENTS IN WALL SHEAR TURBULENCE USING A
   DIRECT NUMERICAL-SIMULATION DATABASE
SO EXPERIMENTAL THERMAL AND FLUID SCIENCE
LA English
DT Article
DE HOT-WIRE MEASUREMENTS; HOT-FILM MEASUREMENTS; ERROR ANALYSIS; TURBULENT
   FLOW; CHANNEL FLOW
AB An error analysis for hot-wire/film measurements in wall shear turbulence was performed using a direct numerical simulation (DNS) database of turbulent channel flow. Fairly complete models of single- and dual-sensor probes were considered so that the effects of spatial resolution as well as neglected velocity components were investigated quantitatively. It was found that the values measured near the wall should be primarily dependent upon the sensor spacing; that is, wall-normal and spanwise turbulent intensities were overestimated markedly, whereas streamwise intensity was slightly underestimated. These errors proved to be caused by strong anisotropy as well as fine scales of the near-wall turbulence. A correction method using two-point correlation functions is also presented. These analytical results were confirmed by a physical experiment with an X-array hot-film probe.

TI THE BEAM-HANDLING MAGNET SYSTEM OF THE KEK PS NEW EXPERIMENTAL HALL
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON MAGNETICS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 12TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MAGNET TECHNOLOGY
CY JUN 23-28, 1991
CL ST PETERSBURG, USSR
SP I V KURCHATOV INST ATOM ENERGY, ALL UNION RES & DEV INST CABLE IND, A A BOCHVAR ALL UNION SCI RES INST INORGAN MAT
AB Construction work of the new counter experimental hall of the KEK 12-GeV Proton Synchrotron (KEK-PS) was completed in December, 1990.  The new hall was planned to be a mini kaon factory from the start.  The beam-handling magnet system of the new hall was, thus, equipped with newly developed radiation resistant magnets in order to handle a high-intensity proton beam, as reported in MT11[1].  Another important point regarding high-intensity beam handling is to realize easy maintenance of the beam line.  For this purpose, all magnets of the primary proton beam line were mounted on special base plates on which quick-disconnect devices for electric power, cooling water, and interlock signals were assembled.  The vacuum connections of the beam ducts located at both ends of the magnet are also operated remotely.  Any magnet experiencing trouble can, thus, be easily removed from the beam line and repaired remotely.
   In this paper we summarize the new ideas and new technologies employed in the beam-handling magnet system in the new experimental hall of the KEK-PS, as well as the first beam commissioning results concerning the beam line.
C1 TOKIN CORP,DIV ELECTROMAGNET,TAIHAKU KU,SENDAI 982,JAPAN.

TI REAL-TIME RECONSTRUCTION OF SCANNED OPTICAL HOLOGRAMS USING AN
   ELECTRON-BEAM ADDRESSED SPATIAL LIGHT-MODULATOR
SO JOURNAL OF MODERN OPTICS
LA English
DT Article
ID 2-PUPIL SYNTHESIS; FIBER
AB Real-time holographic recording has recently been demonstrated (1990, Jpn J. appl. Phys., 29, L1840) using the optical heterodyne scanning technique proposed by Poon (1985, J. Opt. Soc. Am. A, 2, 521), In this paper we discuss the reconstruction of holograms generated by the heterodyne scanning technique. The primary concentration is on real-time reconstruction using an electron beam addressed spatial light modulator (EBSLM). For comparison, coherent reconstruction methods are also presented. Additional topics to be addressed are the spatial frequency limitations of the EBSLM and the derivation of the incoherent point spread function (PSF) of the holographic imaging system. Based upon the derived PSF, the reconstructed real image of a simple slit object is formulated and compared with experimental observations. Descriptions of the scanning holographic recording technique and the operation of the EBSLM are also presented.

TI FABRICATION OF URANIUM-PLUTONIUM MIXED CARBIDE FUEL-PINS FOR IRRADIATION
   TESTS
SO JOURNAL OF THE ATOMIC ENERGY SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA Chinese
DT Article
DE PLUTONIUM CARBIDES; URANIUM CARBIDES; MIXED CARBIDE FUELS; FBR TYPE
   REACTORS; FUEL PIN; FABRICATION; BURNUP; NONDESTRUCTIVE TESTING;
   POSTIRRADIATION EFFECTS
AB Nine pins containing uranium-plutonium mixed carbide fuel were fabricated for irradiation tests in JRR-2 and JMTR to examine the fuel behavior under irradiation and to test the performance of advanced FBR fuels.  Two kinds of fuels with the different compositions of (U, Pu)C1.0 and (U, Pu)C1.1 were prepared by the carbothermic reduction of the oxides followed by sintering.  The basic designs of carbide fuel pins, fabrication procedures and the results of characterization tests are described in this paper.  The irradiations of eight encapsuled fuel pins were completed up to the burn-ups of about 5a/0 at the linear heat rates of 42 approximately 64 kW/m without any fuel pin failure.  A final fuel pin containing thermally stabilized pellets is under irradiation in JMTR.

TI DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF A LARGE CYLINDRICAL TRANSITION RADIATION
   DETECTOR FOR THE VENUS EXPERIMENT
SO NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION A-ACCELERATORS
   SPECTROMETERS DETECTORS AND ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT
LA English
DT Article
ID ELECTRON IDENTIFICATION
AB We describe the design considerations and construction techniques of a large cylindrical transition radiation detector (TRD), 296 cm long and 311.4 cm in diameter, for the VENUS experiment at the e+e+ storage ring, TRISTAN. The design is based on measurements by using test chambers with e/pi-beams and X-ray sources. The test results will be fully described. The TRD contains four modules of radiators, each followed by an X-ray chamber with 8192 (2688) total (sense) wires. The gain calibration of all sense wires has been completed with an accuracy of 5%. The TRD is expected to provide a pion rejection ratio of 15 +/- 3 with an electron efficiency of 90% for isolated tracks with momenta above 1 GeV/c.

TI POSITRON-ANNIHILATION IN SILICON SINGLE-CRYSTALS
SO NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION B-BEAM
   INTERACTIONS WITH MATERIALS AND ATOMS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT SYMP AT THE 1991 SPRING MEETING OF THE EUROPEAN MATERIALS RESEARCH SOC :
   NUCLEAR METHODS IN SEMICONDUCTOR PHYSICS
CY MAY 28-30, 1991
CL STRASBOURG, FRANCE
SP EUROPE MAT RES SOC
ID DIFFUSION; DIVACANCY; DEFECTS; COPPER; SI
AB The positron annihilation behavior below room temperature in semiconductors containing vacancy type defects is temperature dependent. This can be concluded from the temperature dependence of the positron capture cross section of defects or from detrapping of positrons from the defects, Another reason may be that the positron diffusion speed is higher at lower temperature. The characteristic behavior of positrons in semiconductors is discussed.

TI MOLECULAR CHARACTERIZATION AND SILK GLAND EXPRESSION OF BOMBYX ENGRAILED
   AND INVECTED GENES
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE NATIONAL ACADEMY OF SCIENCES OF THE UNITED STATES OF
   AMERICA
LA English
DT Article
DE HOMEOBOX GENES; COMPARTMENTS
ID HOMEODOMAIN BINDING-SITES; BOX-CONTAINING GENES; HOMEO BOX; DROSOPHILA;
   TRANSCRIPTION; REGION; PROTEINS; MOUSE; SEGMENTATION; ACTIVATION
AB Genetic analysis in Drosophila has shown that engrailed (en) plays an important role in segmentation and neurogenesis. A closely related gene, invected (in), is coexpressed with en in the posterior developmental compartments where en is known to specify cell state. We report here the isolation of two en-like cDNAs from the middle silk glands of Bombyx mori larvae. Sequence analysis revealed that they are the counterparts of Drosophila en and in. Four highly conserved domains, including the homeodomain, were identified in these En and In proteins from Bombyx and Drosophila. In addition, two en-specific and one in-specific domains could also be found. These structurally homologous genes might share a similar role in Bombyx development. They were found to be coexpressed in the middle silk gland but not in the posterior silk gland during the fourth molt/fifth intermolt period. We speculate that these Bombyx en-like genes might be involved in the compartmentalization of the silk gland.

AF SUZUKI, Y
   UCHIDA, F
TI HARD X-RAY MICROPROBE WITH TOTAL-REFLECTION MIRRORS
SO REVIEW OF SCIENTIFIC INSTRUMENTS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON SYNCHROTRON RADIATION INSTRUMENTATION
CY JUL 15-19, 1991
CL CHESTER, ENGLAND
SP SCI & ENGN RES COUNCIL, EUROPEAN ECON COMMUNITY, EUROPEAN SYNCHROTRON RADIAT FACIL, EUROPEAN SYNCHROTRON RADIAT SOC, NETHERLANDS ORG SCI RES, DARESBURY RES SERV, ICI, OXFORD INSTRUMENTS, RANK XEROX, CARL ZEISS
ID SYNCHROTRON-RADIATION
AB A hard x-ray microprobe with a grazing-incidence total-reflection mirror system is developed.  The optical system has a pair of elliptical mirrors arranged in a crossed mirror geometry (Kirkpatrick-Baez configuration) and forms demagnified images of an x-ray source.  A focused spot size of 3.5-mu-m x 4.8-mu-m is obtained at a wavelength of 2.3 angstrom.  A focusing test with an x-ray source determined by a pinhole generates a finer microbeam.  Preliminary experiments on scanning x-ray microscopy are performed using the focused x-ray beam.
C1 HITACHI LTD,CENT RES LAB,KOKUBUNJI,TOKYO 185,JAPAN.
RP SUZUKI, Y (reprint author), HITACHI LTD,ADV RES LAB,SAITAMA 35003,JAPAN.

TI MAGNETIC CIRCULAR-DICHROISM AT THE M2,3 EDGES IN 3-DIMENSIONAL
   TRANSITION-METALS AND THEIR COMPOUNDS
SO REVIEW OF SCIENTIFIC INSTRUMENTS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON SYNCHROTRON RADIATION INSTRUMENTATION
CY JUL 15-19, 1991
CL CHESTER, ENGLAND
ID X-RAY-ABSORPTION; 4D-CORE PHOTOABSORPTION; CE COMPOUNDS; SPECTRA; FE;
   NICKEL; IRON; 3D
AB The combined utilization of directly characterized off-plane circularly polarized synchrotron radiation and an ultrahigh-vacuum compatible superconducting magnet has enabled magnetic-circular-dichroism (MCD) experiments, mainly at the M2,3 core absorption edges.  Details concerning the experimental technique, which allowed quantitative MCD measurements, are described.  The results are presented and discussed for single crystals of Ni, Fe, and Fe3O4, and an Fe/Pt multilayer.

TI ISOBARIC ANALOG HALO STATES
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID INTERACTION CROSS-SECTIONS; NUCLEAR RADII; LI-11
AB A study is made on such halo states that are isobaric analogues of the neutron-halo states confirmed in the neutron drip-line nuclei.  A simple formula enables us to predict the excitation energies of the analogue halos.  A semi-quantitative estimate of their decay widths encourages us to pursue both experimental and theoretical investigation, for example, in the A = 11 isobars.

TI CONCEPTUAL DESIGN OF THE STEADY-STATE TOKAMAK REACTOR (SSTR)
SO FUSION ENGINEERING AND DESIGN
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 2ND INTERNATIONAL SYMP ON FUSION NUCLEAR TECHNOLOGY ( ISFNT-2 )
CY JUN 02-07, 1991
CL KARLSRUHE, GERMANY
SP NUCL RES CTR KARLSRUHE, COMMISS EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES, INTERATOM, KRAFTANLAGAN AG, NOELL, DR TRIPPE INGENIEURGESELL
ID BOOTSTRAP CURRENT
AB A conceptual design study of the Steady State Tokamak Reactor (SSTR) has been performed in order to provide a realistic goal for the fusion research.  The SSTR is designed as a DEMO or power reactor to be built in the near future [Y. Seki et al., Proc. 13th Int. Conf. Plasma Phys. and Contr. Nucl. Fusion Res., Washington, USA, IAEA-CN-53/G-1-2].  The major feature of the SSTR is the maximum utilization of bootstrap current in order to reduce the power required for steady state operation [M. Kikuchi, Nucl. Fusion 30 (1990) 265].  This requirement leads to the choice of moderate plasma current (12 MA) and high poloidal beta (beta(p) = 2) for the device, which are achieved by selecting moderate aspect ratio (A = 4) and high toroidal magnetic field (B(t) = 16.5 T).  A negative-ion-based NBI system is used for central current driver to realize steady state operation.  It is shown that a tokamak system based on the small extension of the present physics and technologies can produce net electricity of approximately 1 GW if proper physics and engineering R&D are conducted.
RP KIKUCHI, M (reprint author), JAPAN ATOM ENERGY RES INST,NAKA FUS RES ESTAB,NAKA,IBARAKI 31011,JAPAN.
CR CONN RW, 13TH P INT C PLASM P
   KIKUCHI M, 1991, FUSION ENG DES, V16, P253, DOI 10.1016/0920-3796(91)90197-X

   KIKUCHI M, 1990, NUCL FUSION, V30, P265, DOI 10.1088/0029-5515/30/2/006
   NAKAJIMA H, 1990, ISIJ INT, V30, P567, DOI 10.2355/isijinternational.30.567
   NISHIO S, IN PRESS FUSION TECH
