TI A CONCEPTUAL DESIGN OF A LOW RESISTANCE VACUUM VESSEL FOR THE
   STEADY-STATE TOKAMAK REACTOR
SO FUSION ENGINEERING AND DESIGN
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 2ND INTERNATIONAL SYMP ON FUSION NUCLEAR TECHNOLOGY ( ISFNT-2 )
CY JUN 02-07, 1991
CL KARLSRUHE, GERMANY
SP NUCL RES CTR KARLSRUHE, COMMISS EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES, INTERATOM, KRAFTANLAGAN AG, NOELL, DR TRIPPE INGENIEURGESELL
AB A design study on the vacuum vessel of the Steady State Tokamak Reactor has been performed in order to provide a realistic structural concept for a fusion reactor.  The vacuum vessel and shield are integrated to form a double-thin-wall structure filled with stainless steel and water resulting in a low one-turn electric resistance of approximately 4-mu-OMEGA without insulating breaks or bellows.  The reinforcement plates were welded between the inner and outer skins of the double-thin-wall structure, and shielding units are installed in every chamber with electrical insulation from these skins and plates.  As a result, the requirements for the vacuum vessel can be realized by this simple structure alone.  Transient electromagnetic and structural analysis has been performed for a three-dimensional shell model in the plasma disruption condition of plasma current 12 MA and current decay time 20 ms.  An eddy current, about 95% of plasma current, is induced on the vacuum vessel, and a maximum magnetic pressure approximately 5.8 MPa is caused by the coupling with the toroidal field.  The maximum stress intensity for the magnetic pressure is about 216 MPa.  This low resistance vacuum vessel is extremely effective in shielding the change of the magnetic field in the superconducting toroidal and poloidal field coils during a plasma disruption.  In summary, the feasibility and features of this new type of vacuum vessel concept have been shown in this study.
C1 JAPAN ATOM ENERGY RES INST,NAKA,IBARAKI 31011,JAPAN.
RP SUZUKI, Y (reprint author), MITSUBISHI FUS CTR,MARUNOUCHI 2 CHOME,CHIYODA KU,TOKYO 100,JAPAN.

TI ORGANIC-DYES CO HYBRID DOUBLE LAYERED FILM
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
DE KERR ROTATION ANGLE; DYE; MAGNETOOPTICAL DISK; COMPOSITIONALLY MODULATED
   MULTILAYER FILMS
AB A new enhancement method of Kerr rotation angle (theta(K)) is developed in a hybrid double layered film consisting of a magnetic layer and a dye layer. A strong enhancement is observed near the electron transition wavelength of an organic dye. The wavelength and the value of theta(K), enhancement do not depend on the thickness of the dye film at all. A magneto-optical disk using the structure is very interesting because the electron transition wavelength of an organic dye can be designed easily.
C1 ELECTROTECH LAB,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI EPITAXIAL LATERAL OVERGROWTH OF SI ON NONPLANAR SUBSTRATE
SO JOURNAL OF CRYSTAL GROWTH
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 7TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON VAPOUR GROWTH AND EPITAXY
CY JUL 14-17, 1991
CL NAGOYA, JAPAN
SP JAPANESE ASSOC CRYSTAL GROWTH, JAPAN SOC APPL PHYS, INT ORG CRYSTAL GROWTH
AB We have studied epitaxial lateral overgrowth (ELO) by liquid phase epitaxy (LPE) on non-planar Si(111) substrates and found that the ELO layer has always a planar top surface irrespective of the shape of the substrates.  Two types of substrates, one with a smoothly curved non-planar surface and another with a sharply changing non-planar surface were prepared.  The former was prepared by selective chemical etching.  The latter was fabricated by ELO on a planar substrate.  It is confirmed from SEM micrographs that the ELO layer has a planar top surface independent of the shape of the substrate.  When the smoothly curved non-planar substrates were used, no voids were observed between the ELO layers and the non-planar substrate.  In contrast, when the sharply changing non-planar substrate was used, voids were created between the ELO layer and the non-planar substrates.  However, both types of non-planar substrates have planar top surfaces due to the formation of a (111) facet.  It was concluded that the flat top surfaces can be realized on any type of non-planar Si(111) substrates by employing the present ELO technique.
RP KINOSHITA, S (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,FAC ENGN,DEPT ELECTR ENGN,7-3-1 HONGO,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.
CR AKASAKA Y, 1986, P IEEE, V74, P1703, DOI 10.1109/PROC.1986.13686

TI TRANSPORT-PROPERTIES OF A-AXIS YBA2CU3O7/PRBA2CU3O7 SUPERLATTICES
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MATERIALS AND MECHANISMS OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY HIGH
   TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTORS 3
CY JUL 22-26, 1991
CL KANAZAWA, JAPAN
ID YBA2CU3O7-X/PRBA2CU3O7-X SUPERLATTICES
AB We have measured the resistive transition of a-axis oriented YBa2Cu3O7/PrBa2Cu3O7 superlattices in magnetic fields.  We find for fields applied parallel to the substrate (i.e. perpendicular to the CuO2 planes) that 80% of the transition of a 48 angstrom/48 angstrom multilayer was unaffected by magnetic fields up to 8T.  For a 24 angstrom/24 angstrom multilayer we observe that only the upper 30% part of the transition is insensitive to the magnetic field.  Those results show that no substantial screening currents develop in the CuO2 planes above the crossover implying that each plane is divided into independent superconducting channels separated by insulating channels where the respective channels are determined by whether the rare earth neighbor is Pr or Y.
RP EOM, CB (reprint author), STANFORD UNIV,DEPT APPL PHYS,STANFORD,CA 94305, USA.
CR BRUNNER O, 1990, PHYSICA B, V165, P469, DOI 10.1016/0921-4526(90)90626-6

ID PENETRATION
AB A magneto-optic imaging technique was used to determine the flux density distribution in a disk-shaped thin film of YBa2Cu3Ox at 10 K.  Flux density profiles were analyzed and the critical current was estimated using Bean's model.

TI VERTICAL TRANSPORT-PROPERTIES OF A-AXIS ORIENTED
   YBA2CU3O7/PRBA2CU3O7/YBA2CU3O7 SANDWICH JUNCTIONS
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MATERIALS AND MECHANISMS OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY HIGH
   TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTORS 3
CY JUL 22-26, 1991
CL KANAZAWA, JAPAN
ID YBA2CU3O7
AB We report on the conduction mechanism in PrBa2Cu3O7 thin films and on the transport properties of a-axis oriented YBa2Cu3O7/PrBa2Cu3O7/YBa2Cu3O7 (YBCO/PBCO/YBCO) junctions.  We find that the resistivity of a- and c-axis thin PBCO films is proportional to exp(T-1/4) which suggests that these materials exhibit Mott variable range hopping.  For the junctions one finds two different types of behavior:  either supercurrent-low resistivity junctions or no-supercurrent-high resistivity junctions.  The supercurrent samples typically had barrier resistivities two to three orders of magnitude lower than the resistivity measured on single PBCO films suggesting that the supercurrents observed come from shorts in the barrier.
RP LEW, D (reprint author), STANFORD UNIV,DEPT APPL PHYS,STANFORD,CA 94305, USA.
CR BARNET JB, UNPUB APPL PHYS LETT
   EOM CB, 1990, SCIENCE, V249, P1549, DOI 10.1126/science.249.4976.1549

TI SEARCH FOR NEUTRALINO DARK MATTER IN KAMIOKANDE
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID NEUTRINOS; LIMITS; DECAY; DETECTORS; PHYSICS; FLUX; MASS; SUN; LEP
AB A search has been made for upward-going muons in the Kamiokande detector as a possible signal from neutralino dark matter captured in the Earth. We found the upward-going muon flux from the Earth is consistent with that produced by the atmospheric neutrinos. Assuming the galactic halo contains neutralino dark matter, this result provides limits on the neutralino mass in the region 30-80 GeV and gives stringent constraints on the allowed regions of the parameter space in the framework of the minimal supersymmetric standard model.
C1 NIIGATA UNIV,NIIGATA 95021,JAPAN.

TI PHASE-TRANSITIONS IN AN ANTIFERROELECTRIC LIQUID-CRYSTAL TFMHPOBC
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
DE ANTIFERROELECTRIC PHASE; FERROELECTRIC PHASE; SOFT MODE; GOLDSTONE MODE
ID C-STAR-PHASE; DIELECTRIC-RELAXATION; SOFT MODE; TEMPERATURE; MHPOBC;
   FIELD
AB We studied phase transitions in an antiferroelectric liquid crystal TFMHPOBC (CBH170-para-phenylene-para-phenylene-COO-para-phenylene -star-CH(CF3) C6H13)by means of dielectric measurements and microscopic opservations.  Both a Goldstone mode and a soft mode were observed in the SmC* phase, but only a soft mode in the SmC(A)* phase.  From the temperature dependence of the relaxational frequency, it was clarified that the ferroelectric mode tends to be soft even in the antiferroelectric phase transition.  The unwinding process of the helical structure in the SmC(A)* phase was observed with a reflecting microscope.  It was also found that all the transitions, i.e., SmA-SmC(A)*, SmA-SmC* and SmC*-SmC(A)*, are of the first order.  We present the E(electric field)-T(temperature) phase diagram of the optically pure TFMHPOBC and the mixture of R- and S-enantiomers.
C1 NIPPONDENSO CO LTD,DEPT DISPLAY DEVICE RES & DEV,NISHIO 445,JAPAN.
   SHOWA SHELL SEKIYU CO LTD,CENT RES & DEV LAB,ATSUGI 24302,JAPAN.

TI GROWTH-PROCESS TO THE X-SHAPED TYPE CRYSTAL OF THE PARTICLES OF LEAD
   SULFATE PRECIPITATE
SO NIPPON KAGAKU KAISHI
LA Japanese
DT Article
AB The crystal growth process to the X-shaped type crystal of lead sulfate precipitate was examined by using an optical microscope, a scanning electron microscope and X-ray powder diffraction method.
   Lead sulfate was produced by adding lead nitrate (16.7 x 10(-3) M) aqueous solution at 20-degrees-C to amidosulfuric acid (16.7 x 10(-3) approximately 83.5 x 10(-3) M) aqueous solution, which was hydrolyzed with reaction time (0.5 approximately 6.0 h), at 100-degrees-C.  The thin layer plate of lozenge crystal appeared at the beginning of hydrolysis time and low concentration of amidosulfuric acid (16.7 x 10(-3) M).  With continuing precipitation reaction by the increase of concentration of amidosulfuric acid and hydrolysis times, the crystals grew larger and in the shape transformed gradually from thin hexagonal plate type to short rod type, long rod type, X-shaped type and dendrite X-shaped type crystals.
   The apparent strongest X-ray diffraction line of the lattice planes of the formed precipitate changed with preceeding the precipitation reaction as follows:  (002) plane appeared on the plate of lozenge type, hexagonal plate type and rod type crystals have the flat plane, and (011) plane appeared on the X-shaped type and dendrite of X-shaped type crystals have steric plane.
   The X-shaped type crystal was appeared in the one of crystal from by the change of crystal habit on the growth of the particles of lead sulfate precipitate.
RP SUZUKI, Y (reprint author), YAMAGATA UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT APPL CHEM,4-3-16 JONAN,YONEZAWA 992,JAPAN.
CR KOLTHOFF IM, 1959, J PHYS CHEM-US, V63, P817, DOI 10.1021/j150576a010
   TAKIYAMA K, 1969, J ELECT MICROSCOPY, V18, P93

TI MASS LIMITS FOR DARK-MATTER PARTICLES DERIVED FROM HIGH-ENERGY NEUTRINOS
   FROM THE SUN
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW D
LA English
DT Article
ID HEAVY NEUTRINOS; NUCLEON DECAY; + MESONS; PROTON; FLUX; SEARCH; SPIN;
   CANDIDATES; UNIVERSE; Z0
AB High-energy neutrinos could be emitted from the center of the Sun as annihilation products of heavy galactic dark-matter particles.  We analyze neutrino events observed by the Kamiokande detector to search for such neutrinos.  The observed upper limits on solar high-energy neutrinos from these data set limits on the mass and density of certain galactic dark matter.  The particles analyzed are heavy Dirac neutrinos (nu-D), heavy Majorana neutrinos (nu-M), Higgsinos (h approximately), sneutrinos (nu approximately) with three flavors, and photinos (gamma approximately) as the lightest supersymmetric particles.  Excluded mass regions are obtained for each dark-matter candidate:  3 GeV < m-nu-D < 100 GeV, 3 GeV < m-nu approximately e < 90 GeV, 3 GeV < m-nu approximately mu < 90 GeV, and 4 GeV < m-nu approximately tau < 90 GeV.  No limits are obtained on the masses of nu-M, h approximately, and gamma approximately yet.

TI REAL-TIME, DIRECTIONAL MEASUREMENT OF B-8 SOLAR NEUTRINOS IN THE
   KAMIOKANDE-II DETECTOR
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW D
LA English
DT Article
ID RESONANT AMPLIFICATION; ANTINEUTRINO ASTRONOMY; MATTER; OSCILLATIONS;
   SEARCH; EVENTS
AB The method of B-8 solar-neutrino measurement by means of the reaction nu-ee --> nu-ee in the Kamiokande II detector is described in detail.  A data sample of 1040 live detector days in the time period January 1987 through April 1990 yields a clear directional correlation of the solar-neutrino-induced electron events with respect to the Sun and a measurement of the differential electron energy distribution.  The measured flux of B-8 solar neutrinos from the subsamples of 450 days at electron energy threshold E(e) greater-than-or-equal-to 9.3 MeV, and 590 days at E(e) greater-than-or-equal-to 7.5 MeV relative to calculations of the B-8 flux based on the standard solar model are 0.46 +/- 0.05(stat) +/- 0.06(syst) times the prediction of Bahcall and Ulrich, and 0.70 +/- 0.08(stat) +/- 0.09(syst) times the prediction of Turck-Chieze et al.  The shape of the recoil electron energy distribution is consistent with that expected from the product of the known shape of the neutrino flux from B-8 beta-decay and the cross section for nu-ee --> nu-ee scattering.  Within the statistical error, there is no evidence in the solar-neutrino signal for a significant time variation.

TI ABSENCE OF WEAK-LINK BEHAVIOR IN YBA2CU3O7 GRAINS CONNECTED BY
   90-DEGREES [010] TWIST BOUNDARIES
SO NATURE
LA English
DT Article
ID BICRYSTALS; FILMS
AB ONE of the obstacles to developing applications of the high-T(c) copper oxide superconductors is the low critical current density (J(c)) of the bulk polycrystalline materials, due to the presence of grain boundaries.  On the other hand, these same grain boundaries can be put to good use in device applications, where their low J(c) allows them to be used as 'weak links' in Josephson junctions 1,2.  Dimos et al. 3,4 have shown that the transport properties of certain twist and tilt boundaries degrade as the misorientation angle increases, suggesting that high-angle grain boundaries are generally deleterious to the overall J(c).  More recently, however, Babcock et al. 5 reported weak-link-free behaviour at high magnetic field in an YBa2Cu3O7-delta (YBCO) bicrystal containing two kinds of 90-degrees boundary; they were not able to distinguish between the characteristics of the two types, which were electrically in parallel.  Here we report the observation of 90-degrees [010] twist boundaries in {103}-oriented YBCO thin films.  (Because of the twin microstructure, we do not distinguish between the a and b axes).  Across these boundaries the J(c) and normal-state conductivity are as high as those of high-quality c-axis-oriented films with no high-angle grain boundaries.

   STANFORD UNIV,DEPT ELECT ENGN,STANFORD,CA 94305.

TI NEW COUMARINS FROM CITRUS PLANTS
SO CHEMICAL & PHARMACEUTICAL BULLETIN
LA English
DT Article
DE COUMARIN; CITRUS; RUTACEAE; PEROXYTAMARIN; TAMARIN; CASEGRAVOL;
   CITRUSARIN; HETERONUCLEAR MULTIPLE BOND CONNECTIVITY
ID L STRUCTURE ELUCIDATION; CLAISEN REARRANGEMENTS; ACRIDONE ALKALOIDS;
   CONVENIENT SYNTHESES; TRIFOLIATE ORANGE; NATURAL COUMARINS;
   CONSTITUENTS; COUMURRAYIN; DEMETHYLSUBEROSIN; PONFOLIN
AB Four new coumarins, named peroxytamarin (1), cis-casegravol (5), citrusarin-A (7), and citrusarin-B (8), were isolated from root of Citrus plants and their structures were elucidated by chemical and spectrometric methods.  Citrusarin-B (8), a coumarin having both a dimethylpyran ring and a dihydrofuran ring in the molecule, was also synthesized.

TI REFRACTIVE-INDEX CHANGE OF GAINAS/INP DISORDERED SUPERLATTICE WAVE-GUIDE
SO IEEE PHOTONICS TECHNOLOGY LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
AB The refractive index change of the disordered superlattice waveguides is measured and evaluated.  GaInAs/InP superlattice structure grown by gas-source MBE (GSMBE) is disordered by the Si3N4 cap annealing method.  The measurement of the wavelength response of a Bragg grating waveguide shows that the refractive indexes of the disordered region vary gradually in accordance with the development of the partial disordering.  Maximum refractive index changes are -1.1 x 10(-2) for TE-mode and +6.7 x 10(-3) for TM-mode at 1.5-mu-m wavelength.

SO FEBS LETTERS
LA English

DE OLIGO-1,6-GLUCOSIDASE; PROLINE THEORY; THERMOSTABILIZATION;
   CRYSTALLIZATION; X-RAY ANALYSIS; OVEREXPRESSION
ID THERMOSTABILITY; RESIDUES; CLONING; DNA
AB The gene coding for oligo-1,6-glucosidase from Bacillus cereus ATCC7064 has been overexpressed in Escherichia coli MV1184 cells under the control of the lac promoter in the genetically engineered plasmid pBCE4-2.  Oligo-1,6-glucosidase was purified in large quantities and was crystallized at 25-degrees-C by using a hanging drop vapor diffusion method with 53% saturated ammonium sulfate.  The crystals have the shape of hexagonal bipyramids and belong to the space group P6(2) or P6(4) with lattice constants of a = b = 106.1 angstrom, c = 120.0 angstrom and gamma = 120-degrees.

TI INSITU OBSERVATION OF THE STRAIN OF CO AND NI DEPOSITED ON PD(111) BY
   REFLECTION HIGH-ENERGY ELECTRON-DIFFRACTION
SO JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID PERPENDICULAR MAGNETIC-ANISOTROPY; MODULATED MULTILAYER FILMS;
   MAGNETOSTRICTION; STRESS; PD/CO; CO/PD
AB Co/Pd(111) and Ni/Pd(111) bilayer films were grown epitaxially on single crystal MgO (111) substrates by ultrahigh vacuum deposition.  In situ observation of the strain of Co and Ni deposited on Pd (111) plane was performed by reflection high energy electron diffraction (RHEED) during fabrication.  From RHEED patterns it was confirmed that the lattice constant of a Co film of 2 angstrom in thickness deposited on Pd was about 3.7 angstrom, which was different from that of Pd (3.89 angstrom).  The strain (epsilon-Co) of the Co layer was rapidly released during further Co deposition.  The strain epsilon-Co of the third Co monatomic layer on Pd is nearly equal to zero.  The large strain of the Co layer is localized at about one or two monatomic layers of the interface between Co and Pd.  On the other hand, a Ni film deposited on Pd was not strained from the beginning of the deposition.  The relationship between the perpendicular magnetic anisotropy of Co/Pd and Ni/Pd compositionally modulated multilayer films and the strain of Co and Ni is discussed.

AB Olefin oxidations catalyzed by Fe or Mn complexes of 2,4,6,8-tetratrifluoromethyl-1,3,5,7-tetraethylporphyrin (TFTEP) using iodosobenzene as oxidant were investigated.  Comparison of TFTEP with usual OEP/iodosobenzene systems shows that the electronic effect in porphyrin ring does not seriously affect the selectivity of norbornene oxidations.

   POLYIMIDE FILM; DOUBLE HYSTERESIS; RESPONSE TIME; NUCLEATION GROWTH
ID DISPLAY
AB The influences of alignment materials on switching properties in antiferroelectric liquid crystals have been studied by using three kinds of polyimide resins.  It has turned out that the threshold voltages of the switching between an antiferroelectric state and a ferroelectric state depend on the alignment materials, and that response times are also affected by the alignment materials.

TI SUCCESSIVE PHASE-TRANSITIONS IN ANTIFERROELECTRIC LIQUID-CRYSTAL
   4-(1-METHYLHEPTYLOXYCARBONYL)PHENYL
   4'-OCTYLCARBONYLOXYBIPHENYL-4-CARBOXYLATE (MHPOCBC)
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE FERROELECTRIC LIQUID CRYSTAL; ANTIFERROELECTRIC; FERRIELECTRIC;
   DIELECTRIC CONSTANT; RELAXATION FREQUENCY; FIELD-INDUCED TRANSITION
ID CHIRAL SMECTIC PHASES; MHPOBC
AB A new antiferroelectric liquid crystal (AFLC), 4-(1-methylheptyloxycarbonyl)phenyl 4'-octylcarbonyloxybiphenyl-4-carboxylate (MHPOCBC), was synthesized and an unidentified phase (designated as SmC(x)) was observed between the paraelectric SmA phase and the antiferroelectric SmC(A)* phase by means of thermal, dielectric and electrooptical measurements.  Thermal and dielectric studies suggest that the SmA-SmC(x) phase transition is of the second order and the SmC(x)-SmC(A)* phase transition is of the first order.  Two types of electrooptical responses were observed in the SmC(x) phase:  at relatively high temperatures the tristable switching appeared and at low temperatures tetrastables switching was noted.  These features are discussed in terms of field-induced transitions.

TI PREPARATION AND EVALUATION OF BIODEGRADABLE THERMORESPONSIVE
   MICROSPHERES
SO JOURNAL OF CONTROLLED RELEASE
LA English
DT Article
DE POLY(D, L-LACTIC ACID); THERMORESPONSIVE MICROSPHERES; ACLARUBICIN;
   HYPERTHERMIA; EMBOLIZATION
AB In order to develop thermoresponsive microspheres containing antitumor agents, which are expected to embolize the artery or arteriole feeding the tumor region and to release the antitumor drugs pulsatively by the heat in the hyperthermia treatment, biodegradable microspheres consisting of a liquid crystalline and poly(D,L-lactic acid) were prepared by a solvent evaporation method. In vitro studies on the release of model drugs, indomethacin (IND) or aclarubicin (ACR), from the microspheres were performed by changing the temperature between 37 and 43-degrees-C (the latter is usually applied in the hyperthermia therapy). Although the differences in ACR release between 37 and 43-degrees-C from the microspheres consisting of high-molecular-weight (Mv 64 000) poly(D,L-lactic acid) (HPLA) as a polymer component were observed, the pulsatile release of ACR from the microspheres was not achieved. The effect of an addition of low-molecular-weight (Mn 2600) poly(D,L-lactic acid) (LPLA) as a second polymer component to the microspheres on the pulsatile drug release was evaluated using several microspheres containing IND. It was clarified that the composition of HPLA, LPLA and the liquid crystalline had an important role in the pulsatile release of IND. The pulsatile release of ACR could be achieved with the microspheres which consisted of HPLA, LPLA and polyoxyethylene glyceryl tristearate (PGTS) (5/5/2).

TI HIGH TURNOVER RATES OF DISSOLVED ORGANIC-CARBON DURING A SPRING
   PHYTOPLANKTON BLOOM
SO NATURE
LA English
DT Article
ID HETEROTROPHIC BACTERIA; NITROGEN; SEAWATER; MATTER; GROWTH; PACIFIC
AB OCEANIC dissolved organic carbon (DOC) is one of the Earth's largest carbon reservoirs, but until recently its role in the carbon cycle has been neglected. New methodology 1, however, has led to larger estimates of DOC concentrations and also to renewed interest in the biochemical lability of DOC 2. Previous work found that the mean age of DOC in the surface ocean was > 1,000 years 3. To examine the lability of DOC in greater detail, we have conducted experiments to estimate DOC turnover rates in the upper ocean. We directly observed rapid DOC turnover by bacterioplankton during the spring phytoplankton bloom in the North Atlantic ocean. Potential turnover rates, measured in 0.8-mu-m filtered samples, ranged from 0.025 to 0.363 per day, and were consistent with bacterial biomass production and uptake of dissolved nitrogen (NH4+, NO3- and urea). Our results indirectly suggest that cycling of dissolved organic nitrogen (DON) differs from that of DOC. The high estimates of DOC concentrations and turnover rates repeated here, if found to be general, would seem to demand changes in models 4 of Carbon cycling and of the ocean's role in buffering increases in atmospheric CO2.

TI CHARACTERIZATION OF METALORGANIC CHEMICAL VAPOR-DEPOSITION GROWN GAAS ON
   SI BY MEANS OF X-RAY-SCATTERING RADIOGRAPHY
SO JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID ORIENTATION TOPOGRAPHY; EPITAXY; BOUNDARIES; SILICON
AB Lattice mismatched heteroepitaxial layer GaAs on Si grown by metalorganic chemical-vapor deposition have a crystal mosaicity which gives a local rocking curve of x-ray diffraction as broad as several hundreds of sec in arc.  Since, for such a locally imperfect crystal, conventional x-ray topography provides little significant information, x-ray scattering radiography has been applied to characterizing a GaAs layer on silicon.  Microcomputer-assisted x-ray scattering radiography enabled us to observe a quantitative orientation distribution for the specimen.  The internal structure of the epitaxial layer was quite different from that of the substrate.  A dislocation or a bundle of dislocations observed in the Si substrate did not propagate through the GaAs epitaxial layer.  Lattice planes in the epitaxial layer and the substrate were found to vary their orientation 6 min in arc and 2-3 min in arc, respectively, in a specimen of 6 x 6 mm2 dimensions.  The bending is concave.  The bending mechanism is explained primarily by the difference in thermal expansion coefficients.  It is proposed that climb motion of misfit dislocations may cause the lattice bending of the epitaxial layer.
RP SUZUKI, Y (reprint author), KYUSHU INST TECHNOL,FAC ENGN,DEPT PHYS,TOBATA KU,KITAKYUSHU 804,JAPAN.

TI MEASUREMENTS OF THE CHARGE RATIO AND POLARIZATION OF 1.2-TEV/C
   COSMIC-RAY MUONS WITH THE KAMIOKANDE-II DETECTOR
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW D
LA English
DT Article
ID STRANGE PARTICLE-PRODUCTION; QUARK-GLUON PLASMA; COLLISIONS; ABUNDANCE;
   COLLIDER; MATTER; GEV/C
AB We measured the charge ratio and the polarization of the high-energy cosmic-ray muons arriving with zenith angles from 0-degrees to 90-degrees in the large underground water Cherenkov detector, Kamiokande II. The charge ratio [R(mu+/mu-)] and the polarization (P0) are found to be 1.37 +/-0.06(stat) +/- 0.01(syst) and 0.26 +/- 0.04(stat) +/- 0.05(syst), respectively, at the sea-level momentum of 1.2 TeV/c. This result for the charge ratio is in good agreement with those previously obtained in experiments using magnetic spectrometers at sea level and underground. This is the first measurement of the polarization of the cosmic-ray muons in the TeV region.

TI EXPERIMENTAL GAIN AND SATURATION PERFORMANCE OF GAAS/ALGAAS SCH
   QUANTUM-WELL TRAVELING-WAVE OPTICAL AMPLIFIER
SO ELECTRONICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE AMPLIFIERS; OPTOELECTRONICS; SEMICONDUCTOR DEVICES AND MATERIALS
ID OUTPUT POWER
AB Successful combination of high gain and high saturation output power performance in a GaAs/AlGaAs quantum well travelling wave amplifier is reported.  Comparable performance to similar 1.5-mu-m InGaAs/InP devices is achieved, surpassing expectations.  A device with a three quantum well active region and separately confined heterostructure design has both a small signal gain of 22.9 dB and a saturation output power of 40 mW at the low drive current of 40 mA.

TI INVIVO EVALUATION OF ANTITHROMBOGENICITY FOR ION-IMPLANTED
   SILICONE-RUBBER USING INDIUM-111-TROPOLONE PLATELETS
SO NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION B-BEAM
   INTERACTIONS WITH MATERIALS AND ATOMS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 7TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON ION BEAM MODIFICATION OF MATERIALS ( IBMM 90 )
CY SEP 09-14, 1990
CL KNOXVILLE, TN
AB H-2+, N2+, O2+, and Ne+ ion implantations into silicone rods were performed at 150 keV with doses ranging from 1 x 10(17) to 3 x 10(17) ions/cm2 to improve antithrombogenicity.  The antithrombogenicity was tested by the superior vena cava (SVC) indwelling method for two days in rats with In-111-tropolone platelets, and by the inferior vena cava (IVC) indwelling method for periods of one to seven weeks in dogs.  Results of the SVC indwelling method showed that platelet accumulation on H-2+ and O2+ implanted specimens decreased.  In particular 1 x 10(17) O2+/cm2 implantation caused both accumulation onto specimens and a decrease of the SVC.  Macroscopic views of the ion implanted IVC specimens in dogs revealed little thrombus formation.  It is concluded that ion implantation into silicone rod is a useful technique to improve its antithrombogenicity.
C1 TOKYO WOMENS MED COLL,DEPT RADIOL,DIV NUCL MED,TOKYO,TOKYO 141,JAPAN.

TI SURFACE-ANALYSIS OF ANTITHROMBOGENIC ION-IMPLANTED SILICONE-RUBBER
SO NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION B-BEAM
   INTERACTIONS WITH MATERIALS AND ATOMS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 7TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON ION BEAM MODIFICATION OF MATERIALS ( IBMM 90 )
CY SEP 09-14, 1990
CL KNOXVILLE, TN
AB The chemical and physical structure of ion-implanted silicone rubbers has been studied with regard to blood compatibility such as the reduction of platelet accumulation owing to ion implantation.  In particular, the accumulation ratio of platelets in the superior vena cava revealed that O2+ (1 x 10(17) ions/cm2) implantation was most effective in reducing platelet accumulation.  H-2+, He+, C+, O+, O2+, N+, N2+, Ne+, Na+, Ar+, K+, and Kr+ ion implantations were performed at an energy of 150 keV with fluences between 1 x 10(17) and 2 x 10(17) ions/cm2 at room temperature.  Results of FT-IR-ATR showed that ion implantation broke the original chemical bond to form new radicals such as OH, Bond C = O, SiH, and CH2.  The formation of these radicals depended on the ion species employed:  Bond C = O formation by O+ or O2+ implantation and formation of amines by N+ or N2+ implantation.  The results of Raman spectroscopy showed that ion implantation always produced a peak at near 1500 cm-1, although the intensity of this peak was dependent on the ion species.  The light ions like H-2+ and He+ were more effective than heavy ions in producing this peak, and O2+ implantation was the most effective at producing amorphous carbon.  These results indicated that Bond C = O and amorphous carbon, generated by O2+ implantation, may improve the antithrombogenicity.
C1 INST PHYS & CHEM RES,WAKO,SAITAMA 35101,JAPAN.

AU SUZUKI, Y
AF SUZUKI, Y
TI THE GROUND-STATE STRUCTURE AND THE SOFT DIPOLE MODE OF THE HE-6 NUCLEUS
SO NUCLEAR PHYSICS A
LA English
DT Article
ID ORBITAL SHELL-MODEL; INTERACTION CROSS-SECTIONS; NEUTRON-RICH NUCLEI;
   ELECTROMAGNETIC DISSOCIATION; LIGHT-NUCLEI; LI-11; SCATTERING; ISOTOPES;
   RADII; RESONANCE
AB The ground-state properties of He-6 have been studied in the cluster-orbital shell-model assuming the structure of He-4 + n + n.  The interactions acting between the constituent particles are chosen consistently with all available data.  The particle-stable ground state is obtained.  The calculated proton and neutron densities of He-6 are found to satisfactorily reproduce the total reaction cross sections.  The same model has been applied to study the electric dipole strength corresponding to the soft dipole mode in excited states.  A very strong enhancement of the dipole strength is predicted between 4 and 7 MeV.  This leads to the enhanced electromagnetic dissociation cross sections relevant to the (He-6, He-4) projectile fragmentation.  The theoretical prediction is, however, smaller than the value deduced from the experimental systematics.  The implication of this discrepancy is discussed from the viewpoint of the sum rule for the soft dipole mode.
RP SUZUKI, Y (reprint author), NIIGATA UNIV,DEPT PHYS,NIIGATA 95021,JAPAN.

TI COLORATION OF SN-SB-O THIN-FILMS
SO APPLIED SURFACE SCIENCE
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON SOLID FILMS AND SURFACES
CY AUG 13-17, 1990
CL PROVIDENCE, RI
SP RHODE ISLAND CTR THIN FILM & INTERFACE RES & IND PARTNERSHIP, STATE RHODE ISLAND, DEPT ECON DEV, TECHNOL COUNCIL RHODE ISLAND
HO BROWN UNIV
ID OXIDE
AB Coloration of spray-pyrolysis-deposited thin films of Sn-Sb-O as a function of Sb content as well as changes in resistivity and structure have been investigated.  It is well known that SnO2 films doped with a few % of Sb exhibit low resistivity and high optical transmittance.  However, the resistivity of these films increases with increasing Sb content.  Moreover, the films become darker with an additional bluish coloration with increasing Sb content up to [Sb]/[Sn] almost-equal-to 0.3, but this coloration is noticed to disappear at [Sb]/[Sn] > 1.  To understand this phenomenon, the atomic ratio of the films and the oxidation states of the constituent elements were analyzed by XPS measurements.  In the case of low-resistive and high-transmittance samples, the Sb5+ component, as compared to the Sb3+ component, is dominant in Sb 3d spectra.  The Sb3+ component increases with increasing Sb content.  It was found from X-ray diffraction measurements that the films consisted of SnO2 with partial [100] orientation at [Sb]/[Sn] less-than-or-equal-to 1, and were nearly amorphous at [Sb]/[Sn] greater-than-or-equal-to 4.  The degree of [100] orientation decreased with increasing [Sb]/[Sn].  It is concluded from these results that the darkening is due to optical scattering at the boundaries between SnO2 and Sb2O(O) (x = 3 or 5) micro-grains, and that the broad absorption is based on a charge transfer between Sb3+ and Sb5+.
C1 SHIZUOKA UNIV,FAC ENGN,HAMAMATSU,SHIZUOKA 432,JAPAN.
   NIPPON SHEET GLASS CO LTD,CENT RES LAB,ITAMI 664,JAPAN.
RP NAKANISHI, Y (reprint author), SHIZUOKA UNIV,ELECTR RES INST,3-5-1 JOHOKU,HAMAMATSU,SHIZUOKA 432,JAPAN.

TI KRETSCHMANN ATR-IR SPECTROSCOPY OF INVESTIGATING METAL LIQUID(OR SOLID)
   INTERFACES
SO APPLIED SURFACE SCIENCE
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON SOLID FILMS AND SURFACES
CY AUG 13-17, 1990
CL PROVIDENCE, RI
SP RHODE ISLAND CTR THIN FILM & INTERFACE RES & IND PARTNERSHIP, STATE RHODE ISLAND, DEPT ECON DEV, TECHNOL COUNCIL RHODE ISLAND
HO BROWN UNIV
ID AG ISLAND FILMS; INFRARED-ABSORPTION; SILVER ELECTRODE; CHARGE-TRANSFER;
   GOLD ELECTRODE; CONFIGURATION; THIOCYANATE; GEOMETRY; CYANIDE
AB In the Kretschmann ATR configuration, a short-range strong electric field is generated on the surface of a thin metal film by the collective resonance of free electrons upon incidence of infrared light.  This strong field enhances the intensity of infrared absorption from species present in the immediate neighborhood of the metal surface.  In a few cases, infrared absorption of adsorbed species is enhanced through the coupling of vibration modes with charge-transfer excitation.  Consequently, the Kretschmann ATR configuration is feasible for the in-situ observation of infrared spectra of species on metal surfaces without significant interference of signals from bulk species.
RP HATTA, A (reprint author), TOHOKU UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT MAT SCI,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.

TI NEW APPROACH FOR A COMPUTER-SIMULATION OF THE VACUUM DEPOSITION PROCESS
SO APPLIED SURFACE SCIENCE
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON SOLID FILMS AND SURFACES
CY AUG 13-17, 1990
CL PROVIDENCE, RI
SP RHODE ISLAND CTR THIN FILM & INTERFACE RES & IND PARTNERSHIP, STATE RHODE ISLAND, DEPT ECON DEV, TECHNOL COUNCIL RHODE ISLAND
HO BROWN UNIV
ID SURFACE
AB Computer simulations were made of the formation process of vacuum-deposited thin films by the use of a hybrid method in which a deterministic algorithm and a stochastic algorithm were combined.  The traces of the film atoms were calculated by molecular dynamics, while those of the substrate atoms were generated from a modified Langevin equation.  It was found that the rapid structural relaxation of the deposited film assisted by the thermal energy of the substrate and that of the incident beam was needed for the occurrence of the layered structure of thin films with high crystallinity.  The dependences of the film growth on the energy parameters of the atomic interaction, the deposition rate, and the substrate temperature were studied in detail.
RP SASAJIMA, Y (reprint author), IBARAKI UNIV,FAC ENGN,4-12-1 NAKANARUSAWA CHO,HITACHI,IBARAKI 316,JAPAN.

   HOKARI, Y
AF TOYODA, A
   SUZUKI, Y
   ORIHARA, K
   HOKARI, Y
TI A NOVEL TUNGSTEN LIGHT-SHIELD STRUCTURE FOR HIGH-DENSITY CCD IMAGE
   SENSORS
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON ELECTRON DEVICES
LA English
DT Article
AB A novel tungsten light-shield structure has been developed.  Optical measurement clarified that tungsten film has sufficiently low transmittance value for practical use for more than 200-nm-thick film and is stable up to 1000-degrees-C.  Good step coverage and low reflectance, such as 20-40% for aluminum, required for light-shield film, were also obtained.  A tungsten light-shield structure was applied to a 1/2-in format 668(H) x 575(V) pixel CCD image sensor.  Extremely low smear value, less than 0.001%, was obtained for 300-nm film thickness.

TI DAMAGE INDUCED BY ELECTRON-CYCLOTRON RESONANCE PLASMA-ETCHING ON SILICON
   SURFACE
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
DE ETCHING; DAMAGE; ECR; PLASMA; SILICON
ID ION-IMPLANTATION; CONTAMINATION
AB Physical and electrical damage induced on silicon surfaces by electron cyclotron resonance (ECR) plasma etching is studied.  In sulfurhexalluoride (SF6) plasma etching, shallow (less than 750 angstrom) electrical damage is induced in the surface.  Damage density increases markedly with the increase of microwave power.  Deeper (1-mu-m) damage is formed when radio frequency (RF) bias power is added.  This damage can be eliminated by annealing at 200-degrees-C.  In Ar plasma etching, however, thin (approximately 80 angstrom) physical damage is induced.
